Natural gas vehicles emit less smoke compared to other gasoline-propelled automobiles. The emission of less smoke contributes to the efforts against air pollution. The automobile she is purchasing will be used to provide transportation and taxi services in her area.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is married with six children. Haide is 42 years old and lives in Tangub City, Misamis, Occidental. 

Haide owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for six years. Each month, she earns 25,000 PHP. 

She is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, sugar, coffee, soap and rice. 

In 2009, Haide joined GDMPC. In the future, Haide wants to build a house and see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her store such as canned goods, sugar, coffee, soap and rice.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is from Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old and married with four children. 

Ofelia owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 30,500 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Ofelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is from Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old and married with two children. 

To make a living, Elena sells pork and chicken products in the local community. Elena has been in this business for three years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from her business. 

In 2009, Elena joined GDMPC. Elena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more pork and chicken to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pork and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
At age 51, Leonila is married and lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Leonila owns and operates a food market, where she sells a variety of different products to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP from her business. 

Leonila has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more fruits, food and drinks. In 2011, Leonila joined GDMPC. In the future, Leonila wants to improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits, food and drinks.

loans.name: Nyambayar

texts.en: Nyambayar, 25, lives with his wife in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. The family rents an apartment where they run their computer business. His wife sells spare computer parts to local people while he himself renders computer repair and programming services in remote districts. Due to the constant traveling and taxi service payments, he needs an automobile which runs on natural gas. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase an automobile. He has saved 2,400,000 MNT and the actual price of the automobile he is purchasing is 3,400,000 MNT. As a result, he will be able to spare time for his and his wife’s education and increase customer satisfaction by rendering fast and qualified service.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile.

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Gricelda is one of the members of a group called Luz y Esperanza 1, 2 & 3, comprised of fifteen micro-businesspeople who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, food, and other items. They are located in the city of Samana, a developing tourist town that lies on the Atlantic coast and is rich in natural resources. Gricelda is a single mother with two children. 

Gricelda runs a comedor, which is a little restaurant  that serves lunch in her neighborhood. Gricelda has operated her business for around eight years now and began it with savings she had. She is very excited to be receiving her 8th Esperanza Internacional loan. Gricelda has successfully repaid her previous loans and has taken steps to expand her business.

Gricelda is requesting a loan to purchase chicken, rice, vegetables, beans, other meats and cooking oil for her to cook daily meals for her clients. She will reinvest the profit from her loan in her business. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy goods like rice, beans, chicken, and vegetables.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 50 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. 

Josefina owns and operates her general store, selling a variety of products to earn a living. She earns every month 3,000 PHP. 

Josefina joined GDMPC in 2009. and now she's requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, rice, soap and sugar. She plans to uses the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additonal products to sell like canned goods, rice, soap and sugar.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 48 years old and married. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. 

She plants and harvests coconut and bananas for sale to earn living. She's been her business for more than five years and she earns every month  2,000 PHP. 

Marilyn joined GDMPC in 2008, and now she is requesting a loan of 3,500 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She wants to make improvements to her living situation and also the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid and her husband live in a suburb of Tiribe in the coastal region of Kenya. They have two young children. Her husband is a police officer. Together they provide for their children.

Mesaid operates a food stall, a business which she has run for the last two years. She hopes to expand her business by buying more ingredients such as wheat flour, vegetables, rice, beans, sugar, oils, etc. Hence she is applying for a loan of KES 50,000 to help her.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as wheat flour, vegetables, rice, beans, sugar, oils, etc.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: This time, Arlene is borrowing PHP 29,500 to buy ingredients for her food production business. The general store business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide Arlene and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bangles for bangles selling business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with four children. Gloria is 65 years old and is from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Gloria owns farmland and she plants and harvests rice for sale to earn a living. She's been 39 years in this business. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this business. 

Gloria is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

In 2010, Gloria became a member of GDMPC. In the future, Gloria wants to make improvements to her house and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 68 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. 

She operates and manages a construction and renovating business and also does farming. She's been in her business for 40 years and earns every month 7,000 PHP. 

Lolita joined GDMPC in 2012. Now she is requesting a loan of 9,500 PHP to purchase additional cement and construction supplies.

loans.use: to purchase cement and construction supplies.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 25-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 1 child who is 3.  He doesn’t go to school yet.

Mariam runs a shop and has been in business for 7 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2,500 SSP to purchase sugar, soap, tea leaves, and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In 5 years, Mariam would like to expand her business.

Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Mariam says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva

loans.use: to buy more items like sugar, soap, and tea leaves.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 58 years old and married.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising chickens. Carmencita is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business.

Carmencita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Arleen

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Arleen works hard to support her family.

She sells  frozen foods in the Philippines. Arleen is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods to sell.

Arleen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita, 33, is married with two children. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and manages a general store serving customers in the local community to earn a living. She's been with her business for 6 years, and each month she earns 21,500 PHP. Angelita joined GDMPC in 2009 and now she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional rice, soap, sugar, coffee, canned goods and other items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice, soap, sugar, coffee, canned goods and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric, bags, and shoes intended for resale

loans.name: Fe Arlyn

texts.en:
Fe is 34 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Tangub City Misamis Occidental. 

Fe grows coconuts and bananas for sale to earn a living. She's been her business for more than five years and earns 2,500 PHP every month. 

Fe joined GDMPC in 2005 and now she is requesting a loan of 3,500 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her furniture making business.

Vilma successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Vilma's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 29 years old and married. She has two children, and her husband is a businessman. She runs a tailoring business from her house. With this loan, she will  purchase additional fabrics, zippers, laces, and other items for her business. She started this business in 2008 with a small amount of savings, and now she is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES loan to improve it. She lives in her own house that lacks both piped water and electricity. She wants to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics, zippers, laces, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma works hard to support her family. She is married and buys and sells bananas in the Philippines.

Elma requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell.

Elma has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Elma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sewing supplies for her tailoring business.

Cheryl has been in this business for 30 years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a married father of two children. He owns a retail shop, a business which he has been operating for two years. In this shop, Karisa sells charcoal. He has also begun selling water pipes, sewage construction materials and tanks. 

Owing to a challenge he received last year, he decided to pay off the previous loan and take a new one in this year. Karisa is applying for a loan of 93,850 Kenya shillings to buy other local animals for trading and stock for his retail shop, e.g. pipes, charcoal, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy other local animals, stock in retail shop e.g. pipes, charcoal etc.

loans.name: Amina Wilson

texts.en:
Amina is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 9 years; all of them go to school.

Amina runs a shop and has been in business for four years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 1,500 SSP (South Sudanese pounds) to purchase sugar, soap, beans, and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Amina would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Amina says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like sugar, beans, peas, etc.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en: Ivy is from San Juan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 33 years old. Ivy is married and has six children. To make a living, Ivy has a transportation service business. Ivy been engaged in her business for 14 years and earns 4,000 a month from these activities. In 2008, Ivy joined GDMPC. Ivy is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare vehicle parts and accessories.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of 6 children, Emerita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from selling meat. Emerita is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Emerita  has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Barka

texts.en:
Barka, 25 years of age, is a young and responsible wife who is not yet blessed with a child. She has her own business that provides necessary help to her husband, so together they can support their household. Barka provides M-pesa services, a mobile money transfer platform. 

She needs to improve her business. For this reason, Barka is requesting a loan from Yehu in order to add floats of both deposits and withdrawals in her business. This will allow her to provide service to more customers and thus, receive a higher income.

loans.use: to add floats of both deposits and withdrawals in her business.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne, 48, is married to George. They have been blessed with three children who are 16, 18 and 23. She runs a retail shop and she has been in business for 12 years. Right now her monthly income is 23,000 KES. 

She is borrowing a loan of 30,000 KES which she intend to use to purchase more stocks of sugar, cooking fat, tea leaves and soap to sell in her retail shop.

She plans to pay back the loan with the anticipated profit from the business. Her hope and dream is to buy a taxi in a few years.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of sugar, cooking fat, tea leaves and soap.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Dulce works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Dulce is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Dulce has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en:
Hezron is a 45-year-old green grocer in Kongowea, Mombasa. He is married, and they support five people in their family. He has been in this business for the last five years and has done well. 

He is requesting a third loan to pay school fees for his son who is in secondary school. He hopes to educate his children to a higher level.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his son who is in secondary school.

loans.name: Jean Aida

texts.en:
Jean Aida, age 56, is married and has two children. She is a resident of Balintawak, Aurora. Jean Aida cultivates bananas and coconuts to sell for a living. Every month, Jean Aida has gained an income of 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from her work for 10 years. 

In 2011, Jean Aida became a GDMPC member. She is applying a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She hopes to start planting the crops allotted for the area soon, and expects a large harvest made possible by this loan.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 44 years old and married with seven children.

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, soap and other groceries.

Elvira has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from an Internet café.

Elvira aspires to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
This is Lilibeth, 40, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Rufo, her business partner, and is a mother. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Lilibeth operates a buy and sell business. She buys general merchandise from wholesalers, then sells them with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances and other such products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices, and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP2,000 in sales weekly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP36,000. She will use the loan to buy additional quantities and varieties of products like washing machines, thermos, rice cookers, and water dispensors to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lilibeth dreams of having a stall in the market, and hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional quantities and varieties of products such as washing machines, thermos, rice cookers, and water dispensors to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 52 years old and married with two children. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business selling used clothing to local community members. 

Marites has had this business for almost two years; she earns 15,000PHP monthly. 

Maricel joined GDMPC in 2011. She is requesting a loan of 20,000PHP to purchase additional used clothing. 

In the future, Marites wants to expand her business and to ensure her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Jailane

texts.en: Jailane, 32, is married and lives in Lintugop, Aurora. She has 5 children. She earns a living by selling ice and ice candy. Jailane has been doing this business for 5 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month from it. Jailane has applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. She is a new member of GDMPC. Jailane hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old. She is a married woman with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Evelyn has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

Evelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a 27-year-old clothing dealer in Likoni, Mombasa, Kenya. He is a single man who supports three of his siblings. He has been in this business for the last three years and has been doing well. 

He is requesting his first loan to purchase stock of ladies clothes for his shop and use the anticipated profit to expand this business. He hopes for his business to be more profitable in the future and grow bigger and bigger.

loans.use: to purchase stock of ladies clothes for his shop.

loans.name: Saipa

texts.en:
This is Saipa, 35, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Elyas, who is a vendor, and a mother to their children. Together with her husband, Saipa manages her household while operating her "ukay-ukay" business. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses. “Ukay” literally means to “dig out” or “hollow out” from a stack or heap of anything. Saipa  sells used clothing that is presented stacked up on a table or mat, although special clothing is displayed in hangers. In the Philippines, especially in urban poor communities, many people resort to buying used clothes from “ukay-ukay” stalls because they are much cheaper than brand new clothes sold in malls. Since Saipa's stall is located in an urban poor public market, her business flourishes and she earns a minimum of 300 PHP each day. 

Saipa is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of used-but-quality shirts, shorts, blouses, and pants to expand her business. Customers are attracted to “ukay-ukay” stalls as they have lots of clothes to choose from. Saipa plans to add more pants or jeans, used bags, and footwear. She plans to use the profits from her loan to meet customer demand. Through proper management of capital and profit, Saipa will expand her business and boost her income.

Saipa hopes her business will grow and she will have her own stall. She dreams that her children will finish their studies and have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of used-but-quality shirts, shorts, blouses, and pants

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en: Norberto is married and has seven children. He is 55 years old and resides in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. Norberto runs a general store to earn a living. He has been in this business for 3 years and earns 8,400 PHP a month. He requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo (brand of malted milk), shampoo, soaps, etc. In 2011, Norberto joined GDMPC. In the future, Norberto wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo (brand of malted milk), shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy used clothes and sweaters for thread-making business

loans.name: Jocenil

texts.en: Jocenil is 27 years old, married with one child. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and manages a general store serving in her community. Jocenil has been in her business more than three years. She earns 16,500 PHP each month. Jocenil joined GDMPC last year. She's now requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee and soap. Jocenil plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee and soap

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old and married with two children. She is from Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. For the past three years, she has run a "sari-sari" (variety) store and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month. Maria joined GDMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services. 

Maria is requesting a 4,600 PHP loan to purchase additional goods such as sugar, coffee, soap, and canned goods to sell. She wants to improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Maria plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve her store and support her family's needs.

loans.use: to sugar, coffee, soap, and canned goods to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 33-year-old clothes dealer in Bamburi, Mombasa. He is a single man who is solely dependent. He has been in this business for the last two years and has done well. He will use the loan to purchase more stock of ladies clothes for his shop and the anticipated profit to expand his business. He hopes to grow his business into a wholesale in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ladies clothing for his shop

loans.name: Rexhep

texts.en:
Rexhep is married and has seven children. They live in a village up in the mountains in south-central Albania where the cold is very bitter. 

This is the second loan that he is requesting from the same institution; the first one that was paid on time, was long ago and used for business purposes. Rexhep has been operating an agricultural business for the past 18 years. The loan he is applying for this time is to repair their family home. “Living under such conditions, has become unbearable," Rexhep said. “It is way too cold and living like this is painful,” he added showing around the premises. “I would very much appreciate any financial help I would possibly get from lenders,” was his last statement when he was interviewed.

loans.use: To repair their run-down family home

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte is a 43-year-old villager who lives in northern Albania. She has three children who go to school.

These past days, people in the region where she resides have been challenged by heavy rains and flooding, and so has she. Five years ago, she started an animal husbandry business that has increased steadily, thanks to her hard work and the ability to communicate with locals. Marte has cows, goats and pigs and she sells their products.

Marte is applying for a loan from VisionFund Albania to build a brand new stable for her animals, so they stay warm during this cold winter and also are separate from one another. This loan would be the second for her.

loans.use: to build a brand new stable for her animals.

loans.name: Maripositas Monarca Group

texts.es:
EL grupo “Maripositas Monarca” solo tiene tres integrantes dos mujeres y un hombre los integrantes del grupo eligieron el nombre porque le gustos mucho. Todos ellos viven en una comunidad muy tranquila y pequeña. Doña Fidelina es la representante del grupo platica que tiene 38 años de edad está casada con el señor J Guadalupe quien trabaja en la construcción juntos han formado una familia de seis hijos pero hasta el momento ya solo uno depende de ellos. Doña Fidelina está solicitando el crédito a la institución para poder comprar más mercancía de plásticos como coladeras, cubetas, bandejas, pinzas, vasos etc. Platica que con su actividad lleva ya dos años y la inicio porque en la comunidad donde viven nadie se dedica a la venta de plásticos y pensó que era una muy buena idea iniciar con el negocio.
Después de un tiempo trajo más productos al municipio para venderlos ya que en la comunidad se vende menos y aquí en el municipio hay más clientes Doña Fidelina vende caminando en las calles va ofreciendo sus productos, Es una mujer muy trabajadora siempre está buscando la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar es porque también tiene un puesto de antojitos mexicanos que todas las tardes pone en el municipio a demás también se dedica a la crianza de animales como pollos y guajolotes (pavos) Doña Fidelina comento “Me gusta mucho vender tener trato con los clientes creo no tengo ninguna dificultad vendo lo que tengo que vender aunque si me gustaría que mis ganancias aumentaran para poder ayudar a mi niño con su rehabilitación y que pueda caminar ese es el anhelo mas grande como padres que tenemos", mencionó Fidelina con respecto a su pequeño.

Los integrantes del grupo son Jorge Daniel quien está solicitando el crédito para invertir en su tienda de abarrotes y Karla en la venta de plásticos.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Maripositas Monarca” (Little Monarch Butterflies) comprises just three members, two women and a man, who chose the group's name because they liked it so much. The members live in a quiet, small town. Fidelina, 38, represents a group who sell plastic items. She is married to J Guadalupe, a construction worker, and they have six children, only one of whom is still a dependent. 

Fidelina is applying to the institution for a loan to buy more plastic merchandise such as colanders, buckets, trays, tongs, and glasses. She has been in this business for two years. She started it because no one in her area sold plastic items, so it seemed like a good idea. Over time, she brought more items to the city to sell, as there were more customers there than in her town. She works very hard selling her products door-to-door and is always looking for ways to help her husband pay the household expenses. She also has a stand in the city where she sells Mexican snacks every afternoon, and she raises chickens and turkeys.

Fidelina says, “I like to sell and have contact with the customers. I have no trouble selling what I have on hand, though I would like to increase my earnings so that I can help my son with rehabilitation to help him walk, our greatest wish as parents." The other members are Jorge Daniel, who will invest in his grocery store, and Karla, who sells plastic items.

loans.use: to buy plastic items.

location.town: El Calvario Buenavista, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Francia Ines

texts.es:
Francia de 46 años de edad, originaria de San Marcos, Carazo, pero actualmente vive en Granada, casada, madre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 17 y 19 años respectivamente,  de oficio comerciantes, se dedica a la venta de gaseosa y venta de recargas telefónicas. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio  desde muy joven  trabajando con su mama, fue allí que adquirió experiencia y total dominio del negocio, y decidió poner su propio negocio, la cual se siente muy satisfecha porque le genera ingresos a diarios, ya que ella cuenta con clientes fijos, este ha sido su primer negocio, sus expectativas es aumentar sus ventas.
Ella  está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar más gaseosa por mayor y recargas telefónicas. Ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayudaría a incrementar sus ventas  con el propósito de obtener mejores ganancias, sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, una de sus metas próximas es agregar más productos que aún no tiene en existencia en su negocio.
texts.en:
Francia, 46, was born in San Marcos, Carazo and now lives in Granada. She is the married mother of two children, ages 17 and 19. She is a merchant who sells sodas and reload cards for cell phones. She entered business and gained experience and knowledge as a youngster helping her mother. She decided to start her own business, which pleases her because she earns money every day and has regular customers. This is her first business, and she hopes to increase sales. 

Ella is applying for a loan to buy sodas at wholesale and reload cards for cell phones so that she can increase sales. She plans to upgrade her facilities in the future. Right now, her goal is to add products to her inventory that she currently doesn't stock.

loans.use: to buy sodas at wholesale and reload cards for cell phones.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married with 2 children. Rosita is 56 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Rosita has a beauty salon. She had this business for 35 years. Each month, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP. Rosita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

In the future, Rosita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her salon

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is a married woman and a mother of four young children. They live in Bohol, a province in the Philippines. Her husband works as a motorcycle driver and woodcutter.

Melodina runs a  motorcycle transport business  and a saw machine renting business. Saw machine will be used to cut trees especially for lumber purposes. They also sell timber.

Melodina is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle and for the saw machine.

In the future, Melodina hopes to expand her business and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle and for the chainsaw.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 31 years old and married with five grown children. She is from Mailen, Clarin. For the past five years, Loida has been farming bananas with the help of her children and she earns 6,000 PHP each month. She joined GDMPC in 2012. 

Loida is requesting a 17,500 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs. In the future, she hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her area of cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly is 34 years old and lives in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. For the past 13 years she has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband. This is the source of their income.

Dolly wants a loan from CEVI to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and materials for the repair of the boat, like wood and paint. With this they will be able to improve their fishing business and her husband will be able to increase his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and materials for the repair of the boat, like wood and paint.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Channy is a 42-year-old mother with six children. She lives in a rural village located in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. She has been involved in rice farming in the local area to make a living. She has been in this business for 20 years, earning about 6,000 Cambodian KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

Channy just joined Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, this cycle. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, Channy will use her portion to construct a decent latrine. She hopes this loan will help her family to have a healthy latrine so as to improve their hygienic standard of living.

loans.use: to construct a decent latrine.

loans.name: 02.04.08 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment for fishing. 

Dung is 49 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 02.04.08 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents, her children are grown up.

This is Dung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dung has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Dung faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy. She hopes for her children to find a good job and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 37 years old and married with three children. She is from Lintugop, Aurora. For the past five years, Marissa has owned and operated a nipa-weaving (palm weaving) business where she makes roofing materials. She earns 4,000 PHP each month and joined GDMPC this year. 

Marissa is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Isela Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Isela de 34 años de edad, originaria de Granada, es madre de 2 hijos de 4 y 12 años, actualmente los 2 están estudiando, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y perfumes. Inicio en su actividad laboral con una pulpería, pero miro que este negocio no le era muy rentable,  fue por eso   que decidió emprender este otro negocio como es la venta de ropa y perfumes, con el cual ha podido incrementar las ventas y ha obtenido mejores ganancias, sus expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio.
Se  acerca la temporada escolar y es por esta razón que  Isela está solicitando el préstamo para comprar toda la mercadería necesaria  tales como ropa, perfumes, cuaderno, lapicero, borrador, regla,  etc. con el propósito de agregar más productos que aún no tiene en existencia de su inventario, sus planes futuros es ampliar su negocio para que le genere ingresos extras.
texts.en:
Isela is 34 years old and comes from Granada. She is the mother of two children, aged 4 and 12 years old, who are both in school. She works in retail selling clothes and perfumes. She started her working life at a convenience store, but realized that the business was not very profitable. That’s why she decided to start another business selling clothes and perfumes. She has managed to increase her sales as well as her profits. She hopes to grow her business.
Because children are going back to school, Isela is requesting a loan to buy all the supplies they require, such as clothes, perfumes, notebooks, pencil cases, erasers, rulers, etc. with the aim of adding more products to her inventory. Her future plans are to grow her business to be able to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy school supplies such as clothes, perfumes, notebooks, pencil cases, erasers, rulers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 50 years old and married with 4 children.

Raquel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell, like soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc.

Raquel has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from  gasoline sales.

Raquel aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a repair shop(repair of motorcycle, jeep, car and other transportation vehicle) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy materials and equipment like welding rod, iron rod, wire, etc for her business for her repair shop business.

Myrna has been in this business for 12 years. Myrna earns more income from a general store.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials and equipment like welding rod, iron rod, wire, etc for her business

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 51 years old and single.

She has an entertainment videoke (similar to karaoke) business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Marieta is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for maintenance and to purchase additional unit of videoke for her videoke business.

Marieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for maintenance and to purchase additional unit of videoke of her videoke business

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
Ma. Corazon works hard to support her family. Ma. Corazon is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Corazon is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to avoid future lung diseases resulting from continued toxic smoke inhalation.

Ma. Corazon is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove,she is saving money, she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy works hard to support her parents. Mercy is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mercy is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood she can pick from her surroundings.

Mercy is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove, she is saving money, she helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family. Rosita is 58 and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Rosita requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Rosita has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Rosita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Chidilo

texts.en:
Chidilo is 35 years old. He lives with his family in a village about six kilometers from the town of Kwale. For the past two years, Chidilo has been operating a motorcycle taxi business, working both in the town and in the rural area. He says that his job is risky because he is forced to pass through dark alleys at times. This does not deter Chidilo since he knows that he is needed to put some food on his family's table at the end of the day.

Chidilo is applying for a 50,000 KES loan to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle and conduct general service and maintenance.

loans.use: to purchase spare motorcycle parts and conduct general service and maintenance.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
This is Fatima, who previously took out a loan for PHP 30,000 to buy clothes and pants to sell to her customers. The money she earned from this loan was a big help in meeting her personal, household and business expenditures. She is working hard to continue making money and is applying for a new loan, for PHP 35,000, to buy more items to sell to her customers. Fatima hopes to expand her business and dreams of becoming rich. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and also draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who study religion, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes and pants to sell.

loans.name: Mwanashaban

texts.en:
Mwanashaban is 43 years old and lives in Tiribe with her family. She has six children. She is a serious, calm, and collect person who likes to do things well and with care. She is very dedicated to her work and takes care of her children.
She works at a local business center selling fruit in a small stand. She started this business with a small amount of capital that her husband gave her ten years ago. 
This is the first loan she is requesting from Yehu. She will use this loan to buy more fruit in order to provide a greater variety to her customers. In this way, she can help her family with the expenses that they incur.
Her dreams are to open a mini-market, increase her sales, and improve the quality of life for her family. She would also like to improve the structure of her family's house.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Gezim

texts.en:
Gezim is a 28-year-old single man. He has just returned from Greece, where he immigrated long ago. He is very grateful to all Greeks who helped him settle there; he spoke very highly of them.

Gezim is from a village that has only bumpy roads with no asphalt. Special vehicles are required to get to the village. “I knew that it would take a long time for the community to invest in such things. Knowing that the climate was appropriate for livestock, I was determined to start such activity some years back upon my return from immigration. And I was not wrong. The business has being going well and I am sure that the more time and effort I invest in it, the more income I can generate,“ Gezim said.

The loan he is requesting is to repair his run-down family home.

loans.use: To repair his family home

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has cleared her loan and has acquired her fourth loan of KES. 60,000 to employ more temporary workers in the quarry. She managed to expand her mining business and the business has improved. 

She has acquired several tenders to supply building stones, and she hopes her proceeds will increase so that she can manage to pay college fees for her children.

loans.use: to employ more temporary workers in her quarry

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 44 years old. Danilo is married and has three children. To make a living, Danilo owns and operates a business operating a motor transport service. Danilo has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month. 

In 2012, Danilo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Danilo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Tiaulel

texts.en:
Tiaulel has completely repaid her recent 50,000 KES loan. She managed to get a good harvest for her previous season and used her profit to educate her children. 

Tiaulel is requesting her fourth loan for 70,000 KES that she will use to prepare her farmland and purchase seeds and fertilizer. She hopes to cultivate a variety of crops on a larger portion of her land and use her increased profits to build a permanent house for her family.

loans.use: to prepare her farmland and purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy thread and cloth for her upper stitching business

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is 30 years old, married and the father of three children. He also supports one additional dependent. He earns a living by selling coffee, beans and maize in his town, which is located outside of Kagadi. Jimmy started this business four years ago to support his family and is applying for a loan for 1,000,000 Uganda shillings to expand his business and earn greater profits. He intends to buy more maize and beans because prices are low, and sell after the season is over and prices go up. His dream is to finish construction of his house and pay for the education of his children. His main challenge is transporting his products to market because he is using a bicycle, and fluctuations in the price of agricultural products.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: As the married mother of six children, Jacinta works hard to support her family. She runs a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from firewood sales. She is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment. Jacinta has sustained her business activities with two previous loans from NWTF, and hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
Este BC se llama “Fortaleza” lo constituyen 17 emprendedores quienes , la mayoría, se dedican a la venta de ropa, todos pertenecen a la ciudad de Puerto Montt, región Los Lagos.
Yazna Gomez, quien en la foto aparece de pie, la quinta de izquierda a derecha, viste polera negra; se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 10 años, su lugar de venta son las ferias, trabaja de martes a domingo. Adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Santiago ( capital), mensualmente compra tanto ropa nueva como juguetes.
Yazna usa su crédito para ampliar su mercadería, obteniendo así mas variedad y cantidad en cada tipo de producto. 
Ella se ha fijado como meta de obtener un puesto fijo, establecido en un lugar de buena demanda, a su vez, en lo personal quiere seguir adelante con su negocio para poder educar a sus hijos.
Yazna es divorciada y vive junto a sus cuatro hijas.
Con mucho entusiasmo nos comenta que le ha sido de mucha ayuda trabajar con Fondo Esperanza por la facilidad y comodidad de obtener los prestamos, además de las capacitaciones otorgadas, las cuales le han permitido ordenar su negocio y manejarlo de la mejor manera.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Fortaleza", or "strength" in English, and is comprised of 17 entrepreneurs.  All of them come from the city of Puerto Montt, in the Los Lagos region and most of them make a living by selling clothes.

In the photo, standing up, fifth from the left, is Yazna, wearing a black top.  She has been selling clothes for ten years at the markets, working from Tuesday through to Sunday.  She gets her merchandise every month in the capital city, Santiago.  She buys clothes and also toys.

Yazna will use her loan to increase her stock, by obtaining more variety and a larger number of every type of product.

Her goal is to have a fixed stall, in a place where there is high demand.  On a more personal level, she wants the business to move forward so she can educate her children.

Yazna is divorced and lives with her four daughters.

She enthusiastically tells us that working with Fondo Esperanza has been a big help.  It is easy and convenient to take out loans and, because of the training, she has been able to organise and run her business better.

Puerto Montt is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Lagos region.  One of the attractions of Puerto Montt is its beautiful, green landscapes, its quiet beaches, its food and, particularly, its reputation for fish, seafood and artisan products.  It is also the gateway to the Greater Island of Chiloé, an island brimming with traditions and legends.

loans.use: to buy new clothes and toys.

loans.name: Luisa Emilia

texts.es: Luisa de 55 años de edad, expresa su agradecimiento por brindarle la oportunidad de su  primer Préstamo Kiva, con el cual logro  comprar toda la materia prima que necesitaba para la elaboración de su deliciosa comida, ya que sus pedios ha aumentado,  tiene un poco más de clientela, su primer crédito lo utilizo para la compra de pollo, arroz, aceite, y verduras. Pero su principal prioridad es ampliar su negocio para satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela. Está requiriendo de su segundo financiamiento para comprar, granos básicos, leña, arroz, pollo, tomate, papa, cebolla. Con el objetivo de crecer como una empresaria exitosa.
texts.en: Luisa, 55, expresses her gratitude for the opportunity of her first Kiva loan that she used to buy all the raw materials needed to prepare her delicious food since her orders have increased and she has a few more customers.  She used her first loan to buy chicken, rice, oil and vegetables.  But her main priority is to expand the business to meet customer demand and needs a second loan to buy basic grains, firewood, rice, chicken, tomato, potatoes and onions.  Her goal is to grow as a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy basic grain, firewood, rice, chicken, tomato, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Milton Martin

texts.es:
Milton un humilde habitante de Granada, con  32 años de edad, acompañado, padre de 2hijos entre las edades de 3 y 8 años, el cual solo uno está estudiando su cuarto grado de primaria, el otro todavía no tiene edad para estudiar, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de calzado del que es propietario hace más de 2 año. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio desde muy joven ayudándole a su papa, pero luego al independizarse el decidió emprender su propio negocio de pulpería, pero luego  se separó de su primera esposa y le dejo el negocio a ella para que lo administrara, actualmente él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de zapatos, negocio que le genera  ingresos a diarios, el cual se siente satisfecho porque le va muy bien y cuenta con clientes fijos. 
Sus expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio. Milton solicita el crédito para comprar cuero, suela, pega, clavos, hilo para coser zapatos, etc. ya que el estima que este crédito le ayudaría a comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus zapatos, con el objetivo de dar un mejor servicios a sus clientela, sus planes futuros es ofrecer calzado de muy buena calidad y a un mejor precios.
texts.en:
Milton is a humble resident of Granada.  He’s 32-years-old, has a spouse and is father of two children aged 3 and 8; one attends fourth grade and the other one is still too young to go to school.  He’s a merchant.  He works manufacturing and selling shoes.  He’s owned the business for more than two years.  He started out in commerce since a young age helping his father but then became independent and decided to start his own grocery store.  But when he separated from his first wife she left the store to her so she could manage it and he currently works making and selling shoes, a business that generates daily income and gives him much satisfaction because he does well and has a regular clientele.

His expectation is to make the business grow. Milton asks for the loan to buy leather, soles, glue, nails, etc. to make shoes since he feels this loan will help him buy all the raw materials needed to make shoes.  His objective is to provide better customer service and his future plan is to offer very good quality shoes at better prices.

loans.use: to buy supplies like leather, soles, glue, nails and thread.

loans.name: Nazmie

texts.en: Nazmie is in her fifties, married and the mother of four children, one of whom still attends public school. She and her family live in a village which is not far from one of Albania's larger cities. Almost everyone in this village practices agriculture and raises livestock as a way to support themselves. Nazmie and her family go to the nearby city to sell their products. She has been in animal husbandry for nearly 20 years and is requesting this loan to buy a new dairy cow. She has taken out and repaid previous loans on time.

loans.use: to buy a new dairy cow.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is from Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay. She is 52 years old, married and has six children. To make a living, Trinidad makes and sells bamboo mats (sawali) to tourists and local community members. Trinidad has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Trinidad joined GDMPC. Trinidad is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase bamboo for manufacturing 'sawali'. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo for manufacturing 'sawali' (mats).

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 33 years old. She is married to Wilson and mother of three children. For the past 13 years, Catherine has sold new clothes in Kawangware. She earns a monthly income of 60,000 KES. 

Catherine is requesting her third loan from KADET LTD to build a stall where she can sell clothes and purchase more new clothes to sell. In the future, she wants to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to build a business stall and purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines for the past 10 years. She earns additional income from selling food. Janet has been sustaining her business through her own efforts with the help of previous loans from NWTF. 

Janet is requesting a 10,000 KES loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Olga Mercedes

texts.es:
Olga una humilde señora  habitante de Granada, tiene la  edad de  29 años, casada, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de  4, 9 y 12 años, actualmente los tres están estudiando, de oficio comerciantes, se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y fritos. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio a la edad de 16 años vendiendo enchiladas, la cual le fue muy bien y de las ganancias que obtuvo, decidió vender nacatamales para aumentar sus ingresos y poder salir adelante con su familia. Busco otra manera de ganarse el alimento de cada día vendiendo rifa. Actualmente sobrevive del negocio de venta de nacatamales  y paga los estudios de sus hijos.
Ella está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar arroz, pollo, tomate, cebolla, papa, etc. ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayudaría a comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus nacatamales con el objetivo de incrementar sus ventas para obtener ingresos extras, sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Olga’s a humble resident of Granada; she’s 29-years-old, married and mother of three children aged 4, 9, and 12 years.  Three of them currently attend school.  She’s a merchant; she works selling nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] and fried plantain.  She started in commerce at the age of 16 selling enchiladas and did very well.  She decided to use profits obtained from that to sell nacatamales to increase income and get ahead with her family.  She sought another way to earn her daily bread selling raffle tickets.  Currently, the nacatamales business survives and she’s able to pay for her children’s schooling.

She’s asking for the loan to buy rice, chicken, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, etc. because she feels this loan will help her buy all the raw materials needed to make nacatamales with the goal of increasing sales to earn extra income.  Her future plan is to improve her house’s infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 50 years old and separated with two children. She lives in San Jose, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. For the past five years, Justina has been selling fruit and she usually earns 5,000 PHP each month. She joined GDMPC in 2009.

Justina is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan through GDMPC to buy more fruit to sell. In the future, she hopes to generate more revenue and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Lavdim

texts.en:
Lavdim is in his 50s and has two school-aged children. He runs a construction business that has been going well. Lavdim lives with his family in a village in southwestern Albania.  Many residents of this village, who had immigrated to Greece, are returning due to the economic conditions in Greece. In general, the first thing they try to do is repair their abandoned houses. This generates more business for Lavdim. He plans to have his older son join him in his construction business and he hopes to employ others as well. Lavdim's younger son is doing very well in school. Lavdim plans to pay tuition and send his youngest to university since he has been accepted. 

Lavdim is requesting a 100,000 ALL loan to buy materials and tools for his construction business.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for his construction business

loans.name: Patao

texts.en:
Patao has repaid his third loan of 60,000 KES. He has been able to build a bigger shed to house a larger number of animals and he also planted a variety of crops on his farm. 

Patao is requesting his fourth loan of 50,000 KES to buy more sheep and farm inputs for the next planting season. In the future, he hopes to earn more income and acquire a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: to buy sheep and farm inputs for the next planting season

loans.name: Marry Ann

texts.en: Marry Ann is 48 years old and married with three children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She manages and owns an office supply shop in her local community. She's been with her business for almost 3 years. She earns 7,500 PHP each month. Marry Ann joined GDMPC in 2007 and now is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional supplies to sell, like papers, pencils, etc. Marry Ann plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies to sell, like papers, pencils, etc.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmine is 57 years old and married with 6 children.

Jasmine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jasmine has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Jasmine aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama still lives with her five children, who are under her care. She is an enterprising woman who has been operating a textile business. However, she diverted her line of operation and she now operates a beauty salon, which she says it is doing well. Salama gives thanks for the support she received and that she is receiving since it will allow her to achieve some of her goals. She is grateful for the previous loan which was a starting point for her prosperity. The loan she is asking is to allow her buy shampoo, creams, dryers, among other beauty products.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, creams, dryers, among other beauty products.

loans.name: Verije

texts.en:
Verije, a 45-year-old Roma mother of five children, lives in a main city in the central Albania, within the Roma community. As many others of the same cultural background, she enjoys buying & selling second hand items and has been practicing this for the past ten years. 

Her husband does seasonal work in Greece during summer times and he buys used clothes there at a lower price compared to the price he had to pay to buy those items from sellers in his home country. Yet for the moment, Verije needs to buy items for the winter/spring season without waiting for her husband until summer.  She is seeking a loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek to purchase items to resell in the winter/spring season.

loans.use: To buy winter/spring used items to resell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a widow, age 34, and her four children are between 15 years and eight years old. She buys and sells fish in the Awasi location and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), this being her first term loan, and she intends to use this amount to purchase more stocks of fish for resale. The profits she earns will be used to reinvest in her business and to repay the loan. Her dream is to prosper in her fish-selling business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Florita requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing net and other materials for fishing. She has been in this business for five years now. Florita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her fishing/fish vending business. In the future, Florita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings for the nursery bed, buy organic fertilizers, and hire labour

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, age 62, has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. She and her husband have four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Victoria has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest on his bakery business

loans.name: Amil

texts.en:
This is Amil. He previously accessed a PHP 20,000 loan that he used to buy additional used, but quality clothing. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. He and his wife are working hard to provide income for their family.

He would like to apply for another PHP 25,000 loan to buy additional used, but quality shirts, pants, and shorts. His profits from his business will definitely help him sustain his family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Amil dreams that all his children will finish their studies and he hopes that his business will grow. Every week, he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members, to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional used, but quality clothing needed in his business.

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Mr. Davaadorj, age 27, used to work as a security guard in a large grocery store before starting up his own taxi service business, transporting his customers via motorcycle in town. He lives with his wife and their two daughters in a ger (a traditional Mongolian yurt dwelling) in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife runs a small organic dairy products production and sales business from her home. Their daughters Monhmandah, age five, and Uranmandah, age two, attend a local kindergarten. 

Mr. Davaadorj's wife has been producing organic dairy products and selling these to local customers for some time. She is well-known for her high-quality products among her customers. Mr. Davaadorj is requesting 600,000 MNT in order to purchase inventory for his wife's business. 

He and his wife are both hard-working, diligent, and enthusiastic people.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his wife's organic dairy products production and sales business

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel, age 44, has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She and her husband have four children, all of whom are enrolled in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Hazel has requested a PhP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase fishing materials for her business.

In the future, Hazel would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory items for his retail shop

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old and married. Alice owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 13,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Alice joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alice is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Maria Anita

texts.es:
María tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Lambayeque, en una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 50  familias.  Lambayeque es una ciudad turística llena de historia y tradiciones que la hacen uno de los destinos más visitados en el norte del país.

La actividad que desarrolla María, es la elaboración y venta de chicha de jora, bebida tradicional del norte del Perú. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años, tiempo en el cual ha adquirido mucha experiencia y clientes.  El negocio está situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.

María desea comprar una plancha  de eternit y tejerales, para el techo de su casa, lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.  Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización
texts.en:
Maria is 24 years old, single, and lives in home of her own, located in the Lambayeque district in a small community of approximately 50 families.  Lambayeque is a tourist city full of history and traditions that make it one of the two most visited destinations in the northern part of the country.

Maria makes and sells chicha, a traditional drink in northern Peru.  She’s been doing this for three years and she has gained much experience and many customers.  Her business is in her home and she learned this from her parents, so she knows the field perfectly.

Maria wants to buy roofing materials that will allow her to make improvements to her house.  She knows her business very well but also has a large space to make sales.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials.

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar is 29 years old. He lives in the Marneuli district with his wife and son. Vugar owns a bakery, which is stopped. Vugar has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but he hasn't had any success. He wants to re-start his own bakery, but his loan requests have always been rejected in the past because of his lack of experience, which is usually required by local credit providers. Vugar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Vugar will purchase a dough breaker and will knead dough.  He will bake traditional Georgian bread and sell it for a good price. He owns a commercial space and he hopes his project will be profitable as he already has the baking experience and will offer quality products to his customers. This will increase his sales volume. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a dough breaker

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu, age 31, lives with her family; her husband and three children. She operates a food stall located in one of the busy markets in the town. 

Saumu wants to buy ingredients like flour, oils, basic grains, vegetables, sugar, and tea leaves. For this reason, she is asking for a loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust. Her dream is to own a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, oils, basic grains, vegetables, sugar, and tea leaves for her food stall.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from tailoring.  Victoriana is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more wood to sell for her firewood sales business.

Victoriana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is 28 years old. He is a single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been operating a restaurant. It is a profitable business, but Ammar needs more support to cover his family's needs. He is a hardworking man who works 15 hours a day. 
He has applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER to help him and his family cover the costs of purchasing a chicken grill for his business. 
Ammar is very ambitious man. In the near future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to cover the costs of purchasing a chicken grill for his business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Evelyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Evelyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sheila Jane

texts.en:
Sheila Jane is married with 2 children. She is 23 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zambonga del Norte.

Sheila Jane is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. She has requested to purchase equipment and materials for her garden business.

Sheila Jane has become a member of PMPC this year, 2013. In the future, Sheila Jane hopes to expand her garden to plant other crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to grow vegetables to earn a living

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru:
Исроил проживает в городе Кургантюбе. Ему 60 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей, которые живут отдельно и занимаются своим делом. Жена Исроила портниха. Исроил имеет высшее образование, экономист. По профессии он не работает. 
Исроил более пятнадцати лет занимается торговлей на рынке. На сегодняшний день у него небольшой собственный магазин, где он продает шторы и занавески. Вместе с ним работает его жена. Жена Исроила шьет шторы на заказ, доставка и установка которых бесплатно. 
Исроил берет кредит для приобретения новых видов и расцветок метровых штор и занавесок.
texts.en:
Isroil lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 60 years old, married, and has three grown children who live separately from their parents. His wife is a seamstress. Isroil has post-secondary education and is an economist by training, although he does not work in this profession. For over fifteen years, Isroil has been a retailer at a market. Currently, he operates his own small shop where he sells curtains and blinds. Isroil's wife works with him: she makes curtains to order, which are then delivered to the customer and installed free of charge.

Isroil is taking this loan to purchase new types and patterns of curtains and blinds.

loans.use: to purchase new types and patterns of curtains and blinds

loans.name: Hatixhe

texts.en:
