texts.es: Martha Lorena es una mujer de 37 años, madre de dos hijos de 18 y 11 años de edad, su esposo es chofer de una empresa azucarera y con la ayuda de él decidió emprender su negocio de venta de mercadería en general como: ropa nueva, camisetas, zapatos, blusas, faldas, chores entre otros, negocio que con dinero propio el cual  me dejo la pulpería que actualmente no tiene,  esto lo hice por la necesidad de aumentar los ingresos de su hogar y poder cubrir con los gastos, las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante, tiene clientes muchos clientes fijos en su comunidad, el objetivo de la obtención del préstamo es ampliar su negocio y en un futuro poder realizar mejoras a su hogar y brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Martha esta muy gradecido con la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le han brindado a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua
texts.en: Martha Lorena is a 37-year-old woman. She's the mother of two children aged 18 and 11. Her husband is a driver for a sugar production company. With his help, she decided to start her own business selling general merchandise such as new clothing, t-shirts, shoes, blouses, skirts, shorts, etc. She started this business using her own money which she got from the grocery store that she no longer owns. She did that because she needed to improve her household income and pay for her expenses. She makes traveling sales and has several regular customers in her village. The purpose of the loan is to expand her business and to someday be able to improve her home and provide a better future for her children. Martha is very thankful for the help provided by Kiva lenders to people of scarce financial resources in poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise such as new clothing, blouses, trousers, shorts, t-shirts, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Nora Yamilee

texts.es: Nora Yamilee tiene cuarenta y un años de edad, casada y mamá de una niña de 12 años, quien está comenzando la etapa secundaria. Nora es propietaria de una pulpería ubicada en su casa donde vende granos básicos, productos congelados, medicina popular, dulces, jabones, detergentes entre otros productos de consumo básico,  también vende ropa variada y cosméticos que distribuye en centros de trabajo de su comunidad de forma ambulante, este negocio lo instaló hace doce años con fondos propios, desde que inició su objetivo ha sido ampliarlo, el fin del crédito es invertir en diferentes productos para complacer a su clientela y obtener mayores recursos para brindarle un buen futuro a su hija. Nora agradece el apoyo que los inversionistas kiva le ha brindado para ir poco a poco mejorando su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Nora Yamilee is 40 years old, married, and has a daughter aged 12, who is just beginning high school.

Nora owns a grocery store located in her home, where she sells basic cereals, frozen goods, popular medicine, sweets, soap, and washing up liquid amongst other basic household products. She also sells various clothing and cosmetics door-to-door to workplaces in her community.

She set up this business twelve years ago with her own funds. Since the beginning, her aim has been to expand it. She will invest the loan in different products to satisfy her customers and increase her earnings, so she can give her daughter a better future. 

Nora is grateful for the support offered to her by Kiva lenders, helping her to improve her quality of life little by little.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling foodstuffs such as rice, beans, bread, milk, salt, matches, cigarettes, juices, soft drinks and other items.

loans.name: Mayra Francisca

texts.es: Mayra Francisca es una mujer de treinta y siete años de edad, casada y madre de dos niñas de 3 y 8 años, la mayor es estudiante de primaria. Tiene un negocio de compra y venta de ganado en pie, actividad a la cual se dedica hace doce años, el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres ya que ellos también son ganaderos y parte de su inversión inicial fue heredada por ellos, las negociaciones las realiza en las comarcas aledañas, Mayra cuenta con el completo apoyo de su esposo, quien es Médico General, con el crédito obtenido planea invertir en su negocio para cumplir con su mayor sueño el cual es que sus hijas sean profesionales
texts.en: Mayra Francisca’s a 37-year-old married woman mother of two daughters who are 3 and 8 years of age; the oldest attends elementary school.  She has a business buying and selling cattle on the hoof, an activity she’s been in for 12 years.  She learned the occupation from her parents since they too raise cattle and part of her initial investment was inherited from them.  She does her deals in nearby districts.  She has total support from her husband who is a general practitioner.  She will use the loan obtained to invest in her business and reach her greatest dream which is that her daughters become professionals.

loans.use: to acquire various species of cattle.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenechimeg is 29 years old and lives with her mother in a small house in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her mother, Ulamnemeh, is retired and stays home. Borrower has been working as a saleswoman in the local market since 2008. She has built close relationships with both customers and suppliers over the years. Now, she is planning to start her own business of clothing retail sales, at a rental counter of the local market.

She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory, which will come from Erlian, China. She will use the inventory to start up her clothing sales business in the local market. She is a hard-working, optimistic and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase clothing from Erlian, China, for start-up inventory for her new clothing sales business in the local market.

loans.name: Luis Baltazar

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 54 años creció en el campo con su madre quien con esfuerzo pudo suplir la educación primaria de Luis. Para él fue muy duro reponerse de la pérdida de su esposa, sin embargo no se dio por vencido y luchó por su hijo que quedó en orfandad de su madre. Ahora su hijo es un adulto independiente y Luis vive solo  en la  Parroquia de Río Verde, un lugar histórico de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas. 
Luis desde hace 2 años y con la experiencia adquirida en otros trabajos decidió ser un microempresario independiente, vendiendo bloques de cemento que sirven para la construcción de viviendas. Trabaja todo el día en esta actividad, mezclando el cemento y preparando los materiales. Ahora requiere un préstamo para comprar materia prima de contado y al por mayor para poder incrementar sus ventas que le darán ingresos para mejorar su estilo de vida. Al preguntar a José cómo llegó a Fundación Alternativa para solicitar el crédito que necesita, él responde que fue gracias a la recomendación de un amigo que estaba muy satisfecho con la atención, asesoría, agilidad y confianza que le brindaron y se siente muy emocionado al saber que para el crecimiento de su emprendimiento, hay más de una persona involucrada alrededor del mundo gracias al trabajo de intermediación que hace Kiva en favor de estas personas vulnerables.
texts.en:
Luis is a 54 year old man. He grew up in the countryside with his mother who, with great effort, was able to provide Luis with a primary school education. Getting back on his feet after the loss of his wife was very tough for him. However, he did not give up and struggled on for his son who had lost his mother. Now his son is an independent adult and Luis lives alone in the parish of Río Verde, an area full of history. 

The parish is located in Santo Domingo, the capital of the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province in Ecuador, which has sustained high growth over the past number of years. The most attractive and interesting feature of Santo Domingo city is its delicious fruit and the local gastronomy. The level of business carried out here is also considerable as it has become an inland hub for commercial activity between the country’s mountain and coastal regions. Furthermore, its many tourist attractions and warm climate make it a popular destination for domestic and foreign tourists. For this reason, most of the city’s inhabitants are involved in some form of commercial activity or service for local residents and tourists.

Two years ago, with the experience he acquired in other jobs, Luis decided to become an independent micro-entrepreneur. He sells cement blocks which are used for residential construction. He works all day in this business, mixing cement and preparing the materials. Now he needs a loan to buy raw materials in cash and wholesale in order to increase his sales. This will provide him with income to improve his quality of life. 

When asked how he found Fundación Alternativa in order to request the loan that he needs, Luis replied that it was thanks to the recommendation of a friend who was very satisfied with the service, advise and flexibility and trust that he had received. Luis was very excited when he learned that to grow his enterprise there are people around the world who can make a contribution thanks to the intermediary work that Kiva carries out in favour of vulnerable people.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies to make cement blocks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy scrap, for her husband's scrap selling business

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is married and has four children, and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (cousins). She has a business of selling fish. She has been in this business for three years, selling to all categories of people in her retail shop.

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baskets of fish. She works six days out of every week. She doesn’t have any other side jobs. Her major business challenges include thieves and transportation. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and to educate her children, up to university. She resides in her own house, and the family has no access to electricity or to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish to resell

loans.name: Krisha

texts.en: The Free Artists Network (FAN) was established by Krisha in September of 2012. FAN is a community website (www.freeartists.net) that primarily hosts portfolios for media artists. FAN services allow artists to display their work on personalized web pages, connected through a network of artists, art schools, organizations, and businesses. Upon registering for a FAN account, each member receives a personalized user page that functions as an online portfolio. FAN members may use their online portfolio to display their art work, sell merchandise, join clubs and production teams, start blogs, send newsletters, post their resumes, and find jobs. Krisha is seeking a $10,000 microloan to fund its working capital and website development.

loans.use: To pay for working capital and website development.

loans.name: Nuriya

texts.ru: Нурие 39 лет, замужем. Дети Нурии учатся в Университете Бишкека. По характеру Нурия очень добрый и ответственный человек. Нурия работает воспитателем в детском саду. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, Нурия занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 2003 году. Благодаря упорному труду Нурии, ее бизнес, начатый с суммы 3,000 KGS позволяет ей иметь прибыль в сумме 12,000 сом (KGS) с месяц с продажи молока. На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Нурии имеется 3 дойные коровы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурия обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения надоев молока. Доходы от кредита Нурия планирует вложить в образование детей. А со временем им предстоит женить сына и выдать замуж дочь.
texts.en: Nuriya is 39 years old and is married.  Nuriya's children are studying in Bishkek's University.  Nuriya is a very kind and reliable person.  Nuriya works as a teacher in a preschool.  As a source of income for her family, Nuriya raises livestock, having started this business in 2003.  Thanks to Nuriya's hard work, her business started with a sum of 3,000 KGS allows her to have an income of 12,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk.  Today, Nuriya's household has 3 dairy cows.  In order to further grow her business, Nuriya turned to "Bai-Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows to increase the milk amount.  Nuriya plans to invest the profits resulting from the loan into her children's education.  With time they will marry off their son and daughter.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family. She has a business selling used shoes and has been in this business for 11 years. She has applied for a loan of 300000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. She works six days out of every week and sells wholesale only. She generates additional income from rental rooms. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to start importing used shoes. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is married with one child and her child goes to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 400000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.  She generates additional income through plaiting hair. She moves door to door selling used clothes six days out of every week.   Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda. She aspires to own a permanent business premises and also to become a wholesaler.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is married with eight children and seven of her children go to school. She has a business selling snacks. She has been doing this business for 10 years selling to all categories of people on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of Ugandan shillings 300000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cooking oil, wheat flour, baking powder, cow peas and charcoal.  She generates additional income from rental rooms.  Her major business challenges include    seasonality, defaulters and the ever increasing price of cooking oil. She aspires to own a fully stocked bakery and also to build more rental rooms.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, paying for utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy baking powder, cow peas, baking flour and charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 45 year old man and his primary source of income is the coffee trade. His shamba (small farm or plot of land) sits on over 5 acres. He has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings to purchase manure for his coffee shamba. His yields had dropped and he was advised to apply manure and fertilizers to the land in his plantation. Godfrey hopes to buy more coffee trees from the neighbors for next season's coffee harvest. He also plans to plant eucalyptus trees on an additional 2 acre piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase manure and fertilizer for his coffee shamba (small farm or plot of land)

loans.name: Rolando Laureano

texts.es:
El señor Rolando Laureano esta casado, tiene  28 años de edad,  cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría, lleva 12 años de  experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al tricotado de hilos en diferente colores y diseños, la esposa de Rolando Laureano, inicio el trabajo de tricotado gracias al apoyo de una amiga.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima para su trabajo, consistente en hilos de diferentes  colores, y como también la compra de tramos de nuevos diseños, esto con el fin de tener mas producción de tejidos, y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rolando Laureano is married and 28 years old. He attended three years of primary school. He has two children, one of whom is studying. He makes a living through weaving, and has 12 years of experience.  He counts on the support of his wife who knits with thread of different colors and designs.  Rolando's wife, Laureano, began her knitting business with the help of her friend.  

He is applying for a loan which he will use to purchase primary materials for his work, such as different-colored thread, and also the purchase of sections of new designs in order to increase his production of cloth and to improve his sales.

loans.use: to buy thread and design sections.

loans.name: Las Palomas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La señora Juliana  esta casada, tiene 42 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos que no estudian, se dedica  a la preparación y venta de comida, los 3 tiempos, desayuno, almuerzos y cenas; inicio este negocio haciendo ventas de forma ambulante de casa en casa, hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta con al apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio de ropa.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que  le servirá para la compra de carne, arroz, verduras, condimentos, leches, café en frascos, queso, frijol, etc. Espera su negocio sea mas rentable, ya que espera administrarlo de la mejor manera, en el futuro quiere tener otros locales de venta.
texts.en:
Juliana is 42 years old and married. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has two children who do not attend school. She works by preparing and selling breakfast, lunch, and dinner foods. She began this business by selling door-to-door until she gained 6 years of experience. She counts on her husband's support who works in the clothing business. 

She is organizing a group to be able to request a loan that will help her to buy meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, milk, coffee in jars, cheese, beans, etc.  She hopes to make her business more profitable, and to manage it better.  In the future she wants to have other locations.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 45 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. Бактыгул в качестве  источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается разведением скота. Начав этот бизнес в 2010 году с суммы 50,000 сом, благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Бактыгул имеет в хозяйстве 5 коров, 25 овец и 3 лошади. Ежемесячный доход от хозяйства составляет  около 5,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства, чтобы сделать сбережения на обучение детей.
texts.en: Baktygul is 45 years old, is married and is raising 2 children.  Baktygul as a source of income for her family raises livestock.  Having started this business in 2010 with a sum of 50,000 som, thanks to hard work today Baktygul has a farm with 5 cows, 25 sheep and 3 horses.  The monthly income of the farm is around 5,000 som.  In order, to further grow her business Baktygul turned to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of livestock for fattening and resale.  Baktygul plans to invest the profits from the loan into expanding her holdings in order to save for her childrens' education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for fattening and resale

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en: Felixberta, 48 years old, is married and has five children, aged 24, 22, 19, 17 and 15. They live together in Binoongan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. Felixberta has operated her snack vending business for six years, earning 6,000 PHP monthly to help support the family's daily needs. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase different food ingredients for her business.

loans.use: to purchase different ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is married and lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He has been a mechanic for five years. He currently works as a contracted laborer. Ibrahim was invited to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase lamps, carriers and soldering rods. His ambition is to open his own garage. He is hopeful that this will be a start to increase his income which will form part of the savings for the project.

loans.use: To purchase lamps, carriers and soldering rods.

loans.name: Sladjana

texts.en:
Sladjana is a 29-year-old married woman who has three children. She lives with her family in a minority community in Kosovo. She is a very hardworking woman. Sladjana works as a nurse and also owns a boutique with her husband. They sell different types of clothing and footwear for people with a variety of tastes and styles.

Sladjana is requesting a loan in order to buy clothing and to expand her collection. She hopes to expand her business, to own a large boutique shop and to be able to hire an employee to assist her. Sladjana serves all community members living in Kosovo. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders for this help and appreciates all lenders.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Igball

texts.en:
Igball, 53 years old, is married and has three children. She lives in a small village in Kosovo. She has worked in an agricultural business for a long time. Her husband earns a living as a driver for a private company. Igball's family is also involved in and helps her with the agricultural business. They keep cows to avoid paying for the 5 liters of milk each day that is necessary for her children and family and also to sell milk and milk products in their neighborhood.

Igball is requesting a loan to buy another cow to increase her income and to sell more milk products. In the future, she hopes to renovate her stable and to add more cows. Igball's goal is to improve her life and to offer her children a better and healthy life. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Lord John

texts.en: Lord John is a 35-year-old resident of San Jose, Aurora. He is married and has three children. Lord John has supported his family from the little amount of 15,000 PHP he earns monthly from his palay (rice) retail business for two years. However this year he become a member of GDMPC, and he is applying for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of 30,000 PHP to buy materials needed in business such as sacks, straw, etc. Lord John wants expand his business one day.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in his business such as sacks, straw, etc.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single mother of 4 children, all attending school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Florence has operated a mini bakery business for 10 years. She sells wholesale only and works seven days every week. Florence's major business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of baking flour and cooking oil. She generates additional income by renting out rooms.

Florence has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda Shillings to buy more cooking oil, baking flour and wheat flour. She aspires to own a fully stocked bakery and to see her bakery grow big. Florence resides in her own house and the family has access to piped water but not to electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food for the family and medication.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, baking flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery materials for her son's business

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married with five children, and only one of her children goes to school. She takes care of additional family members (old parents). She has a business of rearing chickens. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of chicken feeds. She has been in this business for five years, sells on a wholesale basis only and works from home. 

Her major business challenges include thieves, seasonality and the ever increasing price of chicken feeds. 

She is aspiring to become a large poultry farmer and also to build more chicken shelters. She resides in her own house, and the family has no access to electricity, but has access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, paying for water bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feeds.

loans.name: Menuri

texts.en: Menuri, 38, is single, living with her five children in a village belonging to the town of Tiribe, Kenya. She’s very enterprising and five years ago started her own business venture. She sells coconuts from her home.   She’s been in three Yehu loan cycles to stay in business. The current loan is for 50,000 KES and she’ll use it to buy a stock of coconuts and cover transport. Her plan is that the business grows and to be able to contribute the family income.

loans.use: to buy a stock of coconuts and cover transport.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is 32 years old and lives in Tiribe with her husband and three school-aged children.She considers herself a simple, respectful and hardworking person.

She has sold clothes (khangas) for two years, selling door to door. The loan she is currently seeking is for the purchase of merchandise (khangas) that she can sell and increase her income.

Her dream is to grow her business, have a prosperous life, and provide an education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell ('khangas')

loans.name: Ema

texts.en:
Ema, 31 years old, lives in the Mtskheta district with her husband, mother-in-law and two children, who go to the local school. The family earns income from their agricultural business. They have cows and sell the produced dairy products locally. Ema has requested a loan from local financial institutions on several occasions for a family business start-up, but she hasn't had any success. She wants to start her own bakery, but her loan requests have always been rejected because of her lack of experience, which is usually required by local credit providers.

Ema has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative through Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Ema will start up her own bakery. She will bake traditional Georgian bread and sell it for a good price. She owns a commercial space in a profitable location and hopes her project will be profitable and will offer quality products to her customers. This will increase her sales volume. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve Ema's family's living conditions.

loans.use: to start up a bakery

loans.name: Marko

texts.en: Marko is a 30-year-old single male who lives in a minority community. He has been working on agricultural land for more than ten years. Marko has had a lot of experience working on his and others' land for many years. This type of job is well paid in his area and is very much in demand. Marko has requested a loan of 1,000 Euros to pay for spare parts for his tractor. The loan will help him to expand his business even further in the future. Marko hopes to buy a new tractor in the future. His goal is to improve his living conditions and to get married. He is grateful to all Kiva lenders for helping him.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts for his tractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a transportation van that will be handy for his small farm business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Manushaqe

texts.en:
Manushaqe, a 39-year-old hardworking Egyptian woman, is married and has three children, two of whom still attend school. The family resides in northern Albania under extreme poverty.

Manushaqe and her husband, Dylber, photographed here, buy and sell scrap metal for cash. They not only search for such items in the cities’ and towns’ large trash bins, but they drive around the region to buy scrap from locals. They have been carrying out this activity for the past ten years. It has been steady and somewhat profitable.

Manushaqe is applying for this loan because she and her husband need money to buy more scrap. Dylber is also talented at repairing vehicles and his dream is to someday have the opportunity to do so.

loans.use: to buy more scrap

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, 43 years old, is married and has 4 children. His primary source of income is agriculture, particularly the coffee trade. John has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy fertilizers for his coffee shamba (field for growing crops). This will enhance his yields since the soil in his area is not fertile enough. John anticipates a double yield from his coffee sales next season. He plans to pay off the loan and apply for more money. John also plans to start a small business for his wife so as to supplement their household income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee shamba

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika, 27, lives with her children in her own house. She wakes up very early to prepare her goods before she starts selling for breakfast. She’s been in business for three years and has gained much experience preparing food. Thanks to this, she earns better profits. 

Masika sells from home and has many customers because people prefer her. This is because everything she sells is top-quality at affordable prices, and the service is good.

Masika is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and who has many goals she wants to reach. She wants to earn a more profitable future for herself and to work hard to reach the success she so desires.

Masika is currently asking for a loan in the amount of Ksh 45,000 to buy required ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder, cooking oils, and food flavors.

loans.use: to buy required ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder, cooking oils, and food flavors.

loans.name: Kulumkan

texts.ru: Кулумкан 38 лет, замужем, имеет одну дочь. Сегодня Кулумкан проживает  в селе Мырза-Аке. Кулумкан имеет среднее образрвание. По характеру очень трудолюбивая, честная и спокойная. Кулумкан имеет многолетний опыт в торговле. Кулумкан  реализуют Орехи, шиповник, сухофрукты на местном рынке. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Кулумкан обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота в торговле. Доходы от кредита Кулумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kulumkan is 38 years old, married, and she has one daughter.  She currently lives in the small town of Myrza-Ake.  She has a secondary education.  By nature, she is very hardworking, honest and quiet.  

Kulumkan has been working in commerce for many years: she sells nuts, rose hips and dry fruits at the local market.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS).  This loan will help her to increase her commodity turnover.  

She is planning to invest her earnings from this loan into further expanding her commercial activity.

loans.use: to expand her nuts, rose hips and dry fruits business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three who lives with her family in the town of Tiribe. She makes a living selling food in a food stall. She has spent two years in this small business, and this has given her valuable experience which allows her to prepare the best food for her customers. Every day Fatuma has more customers who prefer her food because everything is made with the best quality ingredients and is sold at reasonable prices with unparalleled customer service.

Fatuma is a woman dedicated to her work; she is energetic and a fighter who is always looking for options that will open a path to a more prosperous future. She knows that only through perseverance and effort can she achieve the success she desires. Fatuma wishes to take advantage of increasing demand and grow through an investment, but she needs the capital to back it. For that reason, she is asking Yehu for a loan that will allow her to buy wheat flour, maize flour, oils, sugar, salt, etc.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, oils, sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Emzar

texts.en:
Emzar works as an artisan locally and gets a small monthly income. Several times, Emzar has applied for loans from local financial institutions for his business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of his low income and lack of experience in his new business. The local credit providers usually insist on prior experience in the business. 

Emzar’s loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start credits on soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With the borrowed amount, Emzar will purchase a truck. He will be able to provide goods transportation services to local farmers. It will be hard work for Emzar, but, according to estimates, his business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a truck.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 44-year-old farmer in Litein county, Kenya, where she lives with her husband and four children, three of whom have started school. She has been farming for the past eighteen years, producing tea, milk, maize and vegetables, which she sells at the local market.

Beatrice is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase materials for constructing a greenhouse. This will give her more produce that will generate more income to uplift her livelihood and to pay school fees for her children. Beatrice's major farming challenges include lack of readily available markets, high competition and lack of capital. Beatrice is thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for giving her the loan.

loans.use: To purchase materials for constructing a greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a person who has values such as honesty, humility, respect, and hard work that were emphasized by her parents. These qualities have shaped who she is and have allowed her to set an example for her six children.

For the past three years, Rehema has operated a small business selling cashew nuts at the market. She is requesting a loan from Yehu so that she can buy more sacks of cashew nuts to sell. 

Rehema's work requires great sacrifice, yet she performs her duties with great care, since she knows that she will be able to put food on the table each day.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is married and has four children, three of them attending school. She also takes care of additional family members. For the past 16 years, Betty has operated a retail shop business. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and bags of bread. Betty's major business challenges include thieves, defaulters and seasonality. She aspires to become a wholesaler and to build rental rooms. Betty resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, soap and bread

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married and has 2 children, 7 and 12 years old. She describes herself as a focused woman. For the past 5 years, Margaret has operated a retail store where she sells household items. Her business is located within a fast growing area and her primary customers are residents. Margaret describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy household items to sell. Her business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. This is Margaret's second loan, having successfully repaid her previous loan of KES 20,000.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a single woman with one child. She describes herself to be a focused woman.

Racheal operates a butcher shop where she sells meat. Her business is located within a fast-growing area and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate meat to meet the high demand from customers.

Racheal will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy goat meat to sell to customers. 

Racheal’s business goal is to be a supplier of pork meat to the customers within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. She managed to pay her previous loan of KES 20,000 well.

loans.use: to buy a stock of goat meat to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is taking out a new loan to improve her existing business. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for recognizing her as one of the needy people who require such help. She was able to increase her sales through her past loan. Mwanasha will use this loan to buy more ingredients such as sugar, wheat flour, beans, rice, etc. In the future, she hopes to grow her business to a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as sugar, wheat flour, beans, rice, etc.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия жительница города Кургантюбе. Ей 57 лет. Она разведена. У нее один ребенок. Наталия живет одна. Она имеет высшее образование. Наталия более двадцати лет работает бухгалтером. 
Наталия хочет заняться бизнесом. Она просит кредит для приобретения хозяйственных товаров, в основном посуды. Наталия намерена совмещать работу бухгалтера и торговлю. На полученный заем она возьмет в аренду торговую точку на рынке, а также она приобретет товар. В торговле ей будет помогать ее сестра, которая в этой области имеет небольшой опыт.
texts.en:
Nataliya is a resident of the city of Qurgan-Tube.  She is 57 years old, divorced, and the mother of one child.  She currently lives alone.  She has a college degree and has worked as an accountant for more than 20 years.

Nataliya wants to get involved in business.  She is requesting a loan for the purchase of home products, particularly kitchen utensils.  She plans to combine her work as an accountant with her new business.  With her loan, she will rent a retail outlet at the market and also purchase some merchandise.  Her sister, who as some experience in commerce, will help her with the business.

loans.use: to rent a retail outlet and buy merchandise (kitchen utensils)

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 25-year-old single man. He describes himself as ambitious. For the past 2 years, Joseph has operated a retail business selling skins and hides. His business is located in an ideal business environment and his primary customers are industries and local residents. Joseph describes his biggest business challenges to be stiff competition and inadequate high quality hides and skins for selling. He will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy hides and skins to sell. Joseph's business goal is to expand his business so as to create job opportunities for young people within 5 years. He hopes to open several similar retail businesses in the future. This is Joseph's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy hides and skins

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en: Rahim, 35 years old, is married and has 2 children. Rasim was an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli. Now he lives in the Fuzuli region with his wife and children. Rahim needs a loan of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy sheep to improve his agriculture business. His father also has an agricultural business keeping bees and has taught Rahim this business.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en: Zipporah is a 28-year-old married woman who has 2 children, 3 and 8 years old. She describes herself as focused. For the past 4 years, Zipporah has operated a retail stall where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a competitive market and her primary customers are students' guardians and parents. Zipporah describes her biggest business challenge to be the changing fashion styles. She will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more school uniforms to sell. Zipporah's business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes to run a stable business in the future. This is Zipporah's third loan with SMEP DTM, having previously taken out and successfully repaid a loan of KES 20,000.

loans.use: to buy more school uniforms to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 54-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 18 years to 32 years. She describes herself as an innovative woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruit. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic business area and her primary customers are schools, local residents and a hotel. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy fruit and vegetables to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will employ youth in her business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previously, she took a loan of KES 20,000 which she managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Nasira

texts.ru: Насире 48 лет, замужем. Мать 3 детей. Насира начала заниматься животноводством, ставшим основным источником финансирования ее семьи. Насира начала свой бизнес со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS) в 1998 году, и смогла развить свое хозяйство. В настоящее время содержат хорошее хозяйство , дойные коровы, бычки, быки,  МРС, лошадь. На вырученные деньги от животноводства построили хорошие условия для содержания скота, построили пристройку к дому. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса составляет 15,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока и перепродажи скота. Скот она откармливает и продает на местном скотском рынке. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Насира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Насира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем -мечтает купить автомобиль.
texts.en:
Nasira is 48 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has become involved in animal husbandry, which is now the main source of income for her family.  

Nasira started in this business in 1998 with an initial capital of 10,000 som (KGS) and she has managed to expand her activity.  She is currently doing well: she owns some dairy cows, bulls and young oxen, some smaller livestock and a horse.  With the money that she has earned from animal husbandry, she has built an extension to her house, providing comfortable living conditions for her farm animals.

Nasira makes a monthly profit of 15,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk and the resale of fattened livestock at the local cattle market.  

In order to further develop her business, Nasira has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 65,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy more livestock.

Nasira plans to invest her earnings into further increasing her herd.  She is also dreaming of owning a car one day.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Bukuri

texts.en:
Bukuri is a 42-year-old married lady with five school-aged children who lives in a village in south-central Albania. 

This is the second loan for Bukuri; the first one, which has been paid off already, was used to establish a greenhouse business that she has been operating for five years. She produces fruit tree seedlings and sells them to locals.

The loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek that she is requesting this time will be used to expand the greenhouse. This will increase the sales of the seedlings and her income.  "Being the only one to support all my family financially is not easy. I work very hard from morning till night at the business, and then look after my kids who are all young. That’s all my life…,” Bukuri said.

loans.use: To expand the greenhouse in order to produce and sell more fruit tree seedlings

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a single mother of five children and all her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for 5 years selling to all categories of people via retail at the market. She has applied for a loan of  800000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas.   Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to start going to villages of Masaka for bunches of bananas. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Talbak

texts.ru:
Талбак житель района Бохтар. Ему 56 лет. Талбак живет с женой. У него пятеро сыновей. Его младший сын работает таксистом. Остальные находятся на заработках. Талбак имеет средне - специальное образование.
Талбак предоставляет услугу. Он развозит пассажиров на своем микроавтобусе. Этим видом деятельности он занимается пятнадцать лет. Талбак берет кредит для приобретения автомобиля марки STAREX. Он хочет продать имеющийся транспорт и купить новый. Талбак планирует в будущем купить еще одну квартиру, так как семья у него большая.
texts.en:
Talbak lives in the Bohtar Region. He is 56 years old. He lives with his wife. He has five sons. His eldest son works as a taxi driver. The other sons work outside of the region as migrant workers. Talbak has finished technical college.

Talbak provides a service transporting passengers in his minivan. He has been in this business for 15 years. Talbak is taking out a loan to by a Starex van [a Hyundai model]. He would like to sell his present vehicle and buy another one. In the future, Talbak plans to buy another apartment since he has a large family.

loans.use: to buy a Starex van.

loans.name: Jorge Enrique

texts.es: Jorge pudo obtener su crédito con el cual incrementó sus ventas, ahora tiene más clientes a quienes sin importar el fuerte sol o las torrenciales lluvias, les visita para que actualicen los cobertores y sábanas de sus camas. Jorge ha adquirido mucha experiencia en estos 2 años y algún día le gustaría estudiar sobre herramientas de ventas. Este chico emprendedor y soñador es un experto comerciante que por su experiencia asegura que en la temporada de fin de año las ventas se incrementan y es por esto que por segunda vez requiere un crédito para comprar mercadería con la cual pueda cubrir la demanda de los clientes que visita.
texts.en: Jorge was able to obtain a loan which allowed him to increase his sales and now he has more customers who visit him to update their sheets and bedspreads, despite the hot sun or the torrential rains.  Jorge has acquired much experience during these two years and one day he would like to study about sales tools.  This young entrepreneur and dreamer is an expert merchant who is certain that sales will increase during the end of year season, so he is asking for a second loan to buy merchandise with which he will be able to cover his customers’ demand.

loans.use: to buy sheets and bedspreads.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Wilman Alexander

texts.es: Wilman Alexander de treinta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo en casa propia, él se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería en los diferentes alrededores de la localidad donde vive principalmente por la alcaldía de la zona , tiene varios años en el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite realizar cada día mejor su labor, tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren por la calidad, por los buenos precios y sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Wilman es hombre dedicado a su labor, enérgico, responsable pero sobre todo con muchos deseos de alcanzar sus  sueños y salir adelante, su mas grande secreto es la perseverancia sabe que así lograra el éxito; en los últimos meses aumento la demanda en el negocio y necesita cubrir las necesidades de los clientes, pero para ello necesita de capital que le permita invertir por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar billetes de lotería. Wilman Alexander tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a al mismo tiempo tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Wilman Alexander is thirty years old and lives with his wife and son in a home of his own.  He sells lottery tickets in surrounding neighborhoods, mainly in the city hall zone.  He’s had this business for several years and the experience has allowed him to work better.  He also has many customers who prefer to buy from him because of the quality, good prices, and above all excellent service.  Wilman is dedicated to his work, is energetic, responsible and above all has a desire to achieve his dreams and come out ahead.  His greatest secret is his perseverance that he knows will make him successful.  His demands have increased in recent months and needs to cover his customers’ needs, but he needs capital.  He is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL so he can buy lottery tickets.  Wilman Alexander has good payment references and is certain that he will be able to pay off the debt and provide a better quality of life for his family at the same time.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets for resale.

loans.name: Maria Abraham

texts.es:
María es una mujer luchadora con un grado de escolaridad de primaria completa;  junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos se han podido superar gracias a la dedicación en la actividad del cultivo de hortalizas (papa y brócoli), ella tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad ya que aprendió la actividad hace más de 9 años, dicha experiencia la  adquirió cuando se casó siendo su pareja quien le enseñara la siembra y cultivo de hortalizas, sus hijos son estudiantes de primaria y diariamente apoyan a sus padres al salir de la escuela.

María junto a su esposo trabajan duro para que sus hijos no dejen de estudiar y tengan un mejor futuro, un mejor estilo de vida y no pasen por la situación tan difícil que ellos en su juventud pasaron, su producto es comercializado a través de intermediarios que llegan a la zona teniendo una gran reputación por su calidad, higiene y forma de trabajar; pero como toda siembra y cultivo no deja de tener riesgo siendo estos las plagas y la variación de precios en el mercado. Actualmente maría solicita ayuda para poder invertir en la siembra de papa y brócoli comprando fertilizantes, abono, y bombas para fumigación a su producto para que ayude a mantenerlo sano y limpio de plagas.

Su sueño es poder mejorar su vivienda, comprar un pedazo de tierra para poder trabajar y realizar sus propios cultivos; pero la prioridad de ella es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales teniendo una mejor educación y a sí mismo un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
María is a hard-working woman with a primary school education. With her husband and her three children, she has been able to succeed, thanks to her dedicated work growing vegetables such as potatoes and broccoli. 

She has a great deal of experience in this work, as she learned it more than nine years ago. She acquired this experience after she got married, as it was her partner who taught her how to grow vegetables. Her children go to primary school, and every day after school they help their parents.

María and her husband work hard so that their children don't stop going to school, have a better future and standard of living, and don't experience the difficult situation that they did in their youth. Her product is sold through middlemen who come to the area, which has a great reputation for quality, hygiene, and work methods. But as with all farming, there are always risks, such as pests, and price fluctuations in the market. 

Currently Maria is requesting a loan so that she can invest in growing potatoes and broccoli. She will do this by buying fertilizers, manure and pumps for spraying her crop, in order to help keep it healthy and pest-free.

Her dream is to be able to improve her home, and to buy a piece of land so that she can work it and have her own crops. But her priority is to see her children become professionals and have a better future, by having a better education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure and sprayers, for growing vegetables.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grand children). She has a business selling cereals and has been in this business for ten years. She generates additional income through making and selling liquid soap, and farming. She sells on a retail basis and works in a shop she rents. She works seven days out of every week. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 2000000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of beans and ground nuts and boxes of raw materials for making liquid soap. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves, and transportation of commodities from Kampala to her shop. She aspires to own a big factory making liquid soap and also to own a fully stocked retail shop. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans and ground nuts and boxes of raw materials for making liquid soap

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: Immaculate is a single mother of five and none of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has been in the tailoring business for 30 years. She works from her home and works seven days out of very week. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads. She is aspiring to acquire more sewing machines and employ two girls to assist in tailoring.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees for her grandchildren and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing material and threads

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a 29-year-old married woman. She has a daughter who is five years old. She describes herself to be honest, hard working and courageous. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located at a strategic business area along a road and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be few customers turning to the business. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy beauty salon equipment. Her business goal is to build her own house and live happily with her family within five years. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Tabitha previously took a loan of KES 32,700 with which she bought a water tank and installed it. Her family is now happy as they can use the tapped water for their household chores, cow and chickens.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is 26 years old, single and lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. He has been a bodyguard in a company for many years. He is ambitious to look forward. He found a good job but he wasn't able to get it. Unfortunately, he was forced to be a bodyguard to improve his living standards. He started to work as a motorbike driver to get a little bit for his daily expenses. He got a small house recently so he applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies to renew his house. He hopes to buy a bus for transportation to earn more profit in addition to his career.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to renew his house.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu, 36, is married and living with her husband and two children in the suburban area of Kisauni. She’s very enterprising and two years ago started her own business venture. She sells charcoal from her home where she has a small store. 

She says that her business is doing well and she hopes that this loan will be of great help to her. The loan is for 20,000 KES, which she’ll use to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. Her plan is for the business to grow and to be able to contribute to the family income.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en: Mbeyu lives with her life partner and their seven children in a house they rent. She works selling fish from her home. She has been selling for a number of years and has a lot of experience, which allows her to earn better profits. She has many regular customers because she is an excellent saleswoman and because her product is of very good quality and at accessible prices. She is also very friendly when she does business. Mbeyu is an exemplary woman, always dedicated to her work and on the lookout for opportunities that will allow her to get ahead and achieve success in the future. She wants to grow her business but needs to invest in it. For this reason, she is requesting a loan through Yehu, which will allow her to buy more stock of fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a 26-year-old lady. She considers herself to be a cheerful, calm and patient person. She likes to be responsible and likes things to turn out well. She lives with her husband in the town of Kisauni.

Saumu works selling fried potatoes from her home, a business that she has run for three years. This is her first loan from Yehu and she will invest it in buying sacks of raw potatoes and cooking oil. This investment will help Saumu to keep her customers satisfied. 

Her dream is to own a hotel in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is married with four children, and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She has a business of selling used clothes, and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She movers door-to-door selling used clothes and works six days out of every week.     

She generates additional income through selling piped water. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of used clothes. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked boutique and also to start importing used clothes. 

She resides in her own house, and the family has no access to electricity but has access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is married with five children and three of her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has a business selling used clothes. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She has been in this clothing business for five years.  Besides this clothing business, she generates additional income through poultry farming.  She works from her home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality, the ever-increasing prices and defaulters. She aspires to become a wholesaler and to start importing used clothes. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stock of merchandise (cuddly toys).

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: This is Juma. She is 56. A widow, she has five children aged 40, 35, 31, 25 and 20 years. She also has three additional dependents who live with her because she fosters them. In 1997, Juma established her business. Juma says she did not attend school because her parents did not believe in educating female children. Instead, she worked with her mother selling goods. After she was married, her husband, a businessman, helped her establish a business of her own. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 2,100,000 SLL every month. Juma would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Juma requires the loan to buy peanuts for sale. This loan will help her business to grow and generate more profit. In the future, Juma plans to build a shop and provide a quality education for her youngest child. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. Juma hopes you will continue to fund her business, and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts to resell.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah is married with four children, and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business selling snacks. She has been in this business for six years and has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cans of cooking oil, baking flour, cowpeas, and charcoal. She generates additional income through rental rooms. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to own a fully stocked bakery, build rental rooms and also educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more baking flour, cooking oil, cowpeas and charcoal.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has business of selling used shoes and ladies' handbags. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more used ladies' bags and shoes. She has been in this business for 3 years selling at retail to all categories of people. She generates additional income through selling used clothes. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She is aspiring to import used clothes and educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes and ladies' handbags.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en: This is Abdulai, 36. He is married and has 2 children aged 8 and 9. Both of them go to school. He has 1 additional dependent who lives with him to be fostered. In 2009, Abdulai established his provision business. He began his business because he did not attend school; he was only introduced to farming.  When he become an adult, he farmed on his own and the proceeds he got were used to start petty trading. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about 2,580,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000SLL. Abdulai requires a loan in order to buy biscuits, peak milk, matches, paste, drinks, sugar and candles. In the future, Abdulai plans to build a house, educate his children, acquire a shop and buy a car. This loan will help to increase stock and income. He is a hardworking business man. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, peak milk, matches, paste, drinks, sugar and candles.

loans.name: Mohruza

texts.ru:
Мохрузе 32 года. Она очень трудолюбивая и честная женщина. Судьба у этой прекрасной женщины очень трудная, так как ее муж умер, и она осталась без кормильца с 2 не совершеннолетними детьми. После смерти мужа ей не на кого надеется и поэтому она решила организовать свой бизнес, шитьем женской одежды. Мохруза с ранних лет шила женскую одежду, но не использовала свое ремесло в сфере бизнеса.  
С целью организовать свой бизнес она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. От данного курса она обучилась многому, и теперь она уверена в себе, что может создать свой бизнес. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки тканей и других средств, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mohruza is 32 years old. She is a very hard-working and honest woman. This wonderful woman's life has been difficult after her husband died and she was left with 2 underaged children and no one to provide for the family. With her husband gone, Mohruza has no one to rely on, and so she has decided to start her own business of sewing women's clothing. She has always been a good seamstress, but has never used her skills for profit.

In order to launch her business, Mohruza took the course "Succeed", organized by the Association of Business Women, and received her graduation certificate. She learned a lot in the course and is now certain that she can establish her own enterprise. She plans to use her income to provide nutritious food and good education to her children. Mohruza is requesting a loan of 500 somoni to purchase fabrics and other supplies in order to start her business. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other supplies for starting her new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft and hard drinks.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Kadiatu. She is married, and has two children aged four years and six months. One is a school-going child. She has two additional dependents, who live with her because they are fostered. 

In 2006, Kadiatu established her household utensils business. She began her business because though she completed tertiary education and taught for two years, the low salary she got made her decide to engage in business.  

The business has now grown from a stall to a shop. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,650,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of an amount of SLL 4,000,000. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bowls, spoons, stoves and drinking buckets. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to open another shop, educate her children, build a house and become an international business woman. This loan will help to bring additional income to the business. Sometimes the items will go missing or get damaged in travel. She is a hardworking and devoted business woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bowls, spoons, stoves and drinking buckets.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is a married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She is 23 years old and a mother of two young children aged three and four. She is engaged in a fish-vending business. Her husband is a fisherman. Ronalyn is the one who sells the fish to the nearby town. She has been in the fish vending business for three years. When it is not the season to catch fish, Ronalyn also engages in buying and selling fish. 

She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like a fishing net and to have additional capital for her buying and selling business. In the future, Ronalyn would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like a fishing net and to have additional capital.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 53 years old and married with four children.

Nelly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery products to sell.

Nelly has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Nelly aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 52 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

Rebecca has been raising ducks for twenty years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
Joylyn works hard to support her family. Joylyn is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Joylyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Joylyn has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Joylyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Gelly

texts.en:
Gelly is 19 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gelly has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, detergent and other groceries. In the future, Gelly would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Leonora works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and chicken. Leonora is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy materials to maintain her fishing boat and to buy other materials for her fishing business.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to maintain her fishing boat and to buy other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma established PMAC in 1993. Located in Sylmar, California, this martial arts school produces outstanding black belts in the Greater Los Angeles and San Fernando Valley areas. PMAC’s students include a number of state and national champions. Recently, Irma has noticed the need for a child care service for her martial arts school attendees. She is looking for a $10,000 loan to help with the construction of a small child care center. The child care center will help to expand and improve her available services at the studio.

loans.use: to fund the construction of a small child care center for her martial arts school.

loans.name: Budi

texts.en: Budi is re-applying for a loan from MUK. He receives orders for large quantities of chips as his products are already well known. Now he needs additional capital of 2000000 IDR to purchase raw materials such as cassava and seasonings. With the additional capital, he hopes to deliver the orders on time so as not to disappoint his customers. He is very grateful to MUK because they always help in terms of capital.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as cassava and seasonings.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 42 year-old Isatu. She is married and has 5 children aged 5, 8, 11, 21, and 26. 3 of them are going to school. In 2006, Isatu established her household utensils business. She began her business because she was unprivileged to attend school. She used to sell for her foster parent. After fully maturing, her foster parents gave her some money to start her own business.  When she got married, her husband changed the business to a household utensils business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,985,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy buckets, bowls, spoons, plates, sets of pans, and other items. In the future, Isatu plans to acquire a shop, build a house, and educate her children. This loan will help to increase stock and income. She is a hardworking and devoted business woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy buckets, bowls, spoons, plates, sets of pans, and other items.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is 48 years old and married with four children. Liberty works hard to provide for her family. She runs a electronic re-loading business in the Philippines and requested a loan of 25000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional electronic load wallets to sell.

Liberty has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the electronic re-loading business for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Liberty aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase electronic load wallets to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas. Lorna is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials for her fishing business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Monhdelger

texts.en:
Mrs. Monhdelger is 48 years old lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic felt housing tent similar to a yurt) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband, Vanchinsuren, age 50, works at a local military unit. Her daughter, Myagmardorj, age 23, is s senior student at university.

Monhdelger has been running a tailoring service since 2000.  She ran it from her home at the beginning and now she rents a place and sells to local customers. She has built closer relationships with her customers and suppliers over the years and now she is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to pay her daughter's university tuition and living expenses in the city. She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition and living expenses in the city

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cassava production business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 29,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase empty sacks and to repair machinery for her cassava production business. Letecia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is presenting Letecia's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase empty sacks and to repair machinery for her cassava production business.

loans.name: Lhagvaa

texts.en: Mr Lhagvaa is 50 years old and lives with his wife and son in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Surenjav, age 46, herds cattle and sheep and produces organic dairy products which she sells to local customers. His son Bush-Otgon goes to a local secondary school. The borrower has been working as a driver, transporting coal between a mining company and town. He is now planning to start his own taxi service business in town. He is requesting 2500000 MNT to purchase a second hand car to start the taxi service business. He is a hardworking, reliable and decent man.

loans.use: to purchase a second hand car to provide a taxi service business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food processing and meat vending business in the Philippines.

Marivic requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her business.

Marivic has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Jati Ayu Group

texts.en:
Having succeeded in the previous loan period, the Jati Ayu groups proceeds to the next loan. Based on the assessment of MUK, the group received 20,000,000 IDR for group lending and individual persons got 2,500,000 IDR. Because most have been able to increase the number in their pig populations, the current loan was used to buy food and fix the cages.

Ni Nengah used the loan to buy a local sow and build new cages. She was very pleased with the efforts that can be developed. She hopes to become a big pig seller in her village and use all the profits to improve the welfare of her family and make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy a local sow and build new cages

loans.name: Ganbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbayar is 26 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic felt housing tent similar to a yurt) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Battsetseg, has worked at a local meat products producing company for years now. Her daughter, Uchral, age 3, goes to a local kindergarten.

Ganbayar has been running a taxi service business in town since 2010. His car has been broken for a while and needed replacement. He is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a better second-hand car than his to provide taxi service business in town. He is a hardworking, positive and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase a better second-hand car than his to provide taxi service business in town

loans.name: Ma. Corazon
