It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells different vegetables. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects an expansion in her business income as she enlarges her business. 

Rose hopes to make her variety store a grocery store and dreams to become rich. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mwanajabu

texts.en: Mwanajabu, 53 years old, is a divorced woman from Likoni. She runs a kiosk which is well stocked with all kinds of essential goods and she has been in business for more than ten years. Mwanajabu is a person who stands out on account of her desire to work and succeed through her business. She always strives to achieve success so as to help her family. Mwanajabu is seeking this loan to stock her store with drinks, baked goods, and vegetables so that she can maintain her sales.

loans.use: to stock her store with drinks, baked goods, and vegetables

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has been blessed with seven children. She operates a cereals shop and has been in business for the past 12 years. She also runs a butcher shop and she previously practiced farming. Mary is very hard working and diligent. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money for future purposes.

Mary hopes to become a wholesaler and open other outlets. She is requesting a loan of 63,585 KES to buy maize, beans, french beans, and peas.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, french beans, and peas

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help regarding her child’s education, and personal, household and business expenditures. She has been in this business only a year, but she was able to attract customers, and her business is continuously growing.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed in the store the better. More items will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jennifer hopes to expand her business and become as big as a grocery store. She dreams of buying her own house. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and it's where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Sonia has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Sonia would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 69 years old and from Ndunyu Njeru. He is married and has one child who is 18 years old and in high school.

Michael is a landlord and has been in this business for the past 10 years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy iron sheets for roofing the houses he is building.

He hopes to have many houses in the near future and to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for roofing

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine started raising cows in the early 1990s but with only a few animals. When Ugafode Microfinance Limited started in Rukungiri, he joined so as to get money to buy more cows.This therefore boosted milk production on his farm.

He was able to get a loan and managed to buy a car in 2007, which he used to take milk to the dairy. Augustine also bought a solar system from one of the loans from Ugafode Microfinance Limited. He has also been able to educate his children and look after his family in a decent manner.

He now wants to buy more cows with the loan he is getting to increase milk production and earn more income. Thank you for the great services.

loans.use: to buy more cows to increase milk production.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is asking for a new loan to expand his existing business. Thanks to his efforts and the support of Kiva lenders, he has little by little taken his business into a high level. He has faith that this current loan will enable his business to flourish more and more. Boniface says that since he received his previous loan, his living standards have been improving and he can now count on increased sales. With this loan he will be able to renovate and expand his chicken house and buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to renovate and expand his chicken house and buy chicken feed.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 41, is from Nyandarua South. He is married with four children who are aged between 7 and 17 years old.

John is a farmer and has been farming for the past 27 years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and maize seedlings. He is optimistic that his farm will do well after the loan.

He hopes to become the leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 38-year-old lady who is married and has three children. She has been in business for the past seven years.  She used her previous loan to add stock of medicine. Her business did very well and she repaid her loan.  Mary is an ambitious lady and hopes for excellence in the future. Faulu Kenya has helped her save for future purposes.

Someday Mary hopes to open a wholesale shop. She now requires a loan of 63,585 KES to add stock of natural medicine.

loans.use: To add stock of medicine

loans.name: David Flaminio

texts.es: David de 32 años de edad vive junto  a su familia su esposa y sus hijos. Es un hombre visionario que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un hijo, un padre y esposo ejemplar  que sus deseos de superación siempre han sido altos, siendo responsable, honesto, humilde, trabajador y muy emprendedor. Se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos como maiz y frijol. Aparte cuando no hay mucha epoca de cultivo se dedica a la labor de ser jornalero, esta es su principal fuente de ingreso desde hace varios años se ha dedicado a esta actividad y lo hace con esfuerzo y dedicación. David desea comprar insumos para seguir comercializando insumos basicos y que no se le arruinen por no tener lo necesario para cultivarlos es por eso que ha tomado la iniciativa de acercarse a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito y comprar insumos como: Abonos, Fertilizantes, Pesticidas u otros. Espera que la ayuda que solicita se le sea dada ya que cuenta con buenas referencias de pagos y espera saldar la deuda antes de lo previsto.
texts.en:
32-year old David lives with his wife and children. He is a man with an eye on the future, and that characteristic has always made him an exemplary son, father and husband. His wish to get ahead in life has always been great; he is responsible, honest, straightforward, hardworking and enterprising.

David earns his living growing basic grains such as maize and beans. As well, when there is not much work on his farm, he takes on jobs as a day laborer. Farming has been his principal source of income for several years, and he has put in a lot of effort and dedication. He now wishes to buy basic agricultural supplies so that his crops aren’t ruined. For this reason he has approached INTEGRAL to ask for a loan to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticides etc. He hopes that he will be granted a loan as he has good references and expects to pay back the money early.

loans.use: buy manure, fertilizer, pesticides etc.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 41 years old and married, with two children.

Emelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail, coconut wine-selling business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Emelia has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the retail coconut wine business for 22 years, and she also earns an income from fishing.

Emelia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to resell

loans.name: Ariunbold

texts.en:
Ariunbold is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Purevjav, age 33, has worked with her husband in a local shoe manufacturing company since 2005. His son Lhagvasuren, age 6, has just enrolled in a local primary school, and his younger son, Choijilsuren, age 2, goes to a local kindergarten. 

He has been working for a local shoe manufacturer for years, but now he is starting his own cobbler business on his plot of land. He is requesting 900,000 MNT to purchase leather and other inventory for his new cobbler business. He is hardworking, talkative and open-minded.

loans.use: to purchase leather and other inventory for his new cobbler business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Jennifer, 42, is a married lady blessed with five children aged between 8 and 20 years old. She sells fresh milk and has been in operation for a period of seven years. She earns an income of 7,000 KES per month.

She has borrowed a loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD. This is her first loan and she wishes to use it to pay the milk suppliers. She also wants to diversify her business and start selling cereals with this loan.  

The profits she earns will be used to pay the loan back. Her dream is to diversify her business and ensure her that children get the best education.

loans.use: to pay her milk suppliers.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 32 years old and has three children. She has been in business for the past five years and she is very hard working. Miriam used her previous loan to buy charcoal. Her business did very well and she successfully repaid her loan. She also weaves to earn an income.

Miriam dreams of expanding her business. She now requires a loan of 63,585 KES to buy charcoal.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 40 years old and married. She has four children between the ages of 3 and 20 years old. She runs a retail shop and has been in the business for a period of 11 years, generating a monthly income of KES 6,000.

Everlyne has borrowed her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. With this loan she intends to purchase more stock for her retail shop. She anticipates earning profits which she will use to pay school fees for her children. She will use the surplus to expand her business. 

Everlyne hopes to improve her living standards, be financially stable, and give her children the best education.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, and tea leaves.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a very hardworking 46-year-old divorced woman with four children. She has been able to make improvements to her home and have a large number of products to offer her customers, thanks to her hard work.

Zawadi grows and sells farm produce, increasing her income greatly and allowing her to continue helping her family.

Zawadi is asking for loan so that she can buy more land to plant. This will allow her to continue working. She is grateful for the help she has received.

loans.use: to buy more land to plant.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is happy that his grocery store is doing well, but his aim is to see it grow into a wholesale business. He says, however, that his inventory has gone down and he lacks basic items. He does not want to disappoint his customers with this lack of goods. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan to boost his working capital. With this new loan, he will buy more stocks of flour, basic grains, cleaning products, and basic medicines. He say thanks for the previous loan that increased his sales.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of flour, basic grains, cleaning products, and basic medicines.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de 45años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su familia. Ella se dedica  a la agricultura de los principales granos básicos como son: maíz y frijol, y tambien cultiva loroco y jocotes. Después de sacar la cosecha  comercializa una parte de su cultivo para poder suplir las necesidades de su hogar que cada día son mayores. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y admirable lo más importante en la vida es ganarse el pan de cada día dignamente con el trabajo de sus manos . Ha trabajado toda su vida en la agricultura y es así como ha logrado sobrevivir, puesto que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos diferente a la agricultura. Como toda mujer emprendedora y visionaria ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución ya que la fecha para empezar las siembras se aproximan y quiere estar preparada.  Es por esta razón que solicita este préstamo a INTEGRAL para invertir en la comprar de los insumos agrícolas como: semillas, insecticidas, abonos u  otros. Para comenzar la siembra lo más antes posible y poder cosechar los frutos de su esfuerzo. Confía plenamente que obtendrá una cosecha abundante la cual la cual le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos, 45 years old, lives in a house she owns, together with her family. She works in agriculture, growing the main basic grains: maize and beans. She also grows loroco (a kind of vine with edible flowers) and jocotes (sineguela fruit). After harvesting, she sells part of her crop in order to meet her household needs which are increasing on a daily basis. She is an admirable and enterprising woman. Her priority is to earn a living in a dignified way, working with her hands. 

She has worked all her life in agriculture. This is how she has managed to survive as she has no other source of income other than agriculture. Like all enterprising and visionary women, she has taken the decision to approach this institution as the sowing season is starting soon and she wants to be prepared. 

For this reason she is requesting this loan from Integral, in order to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies, such seeds, insecticides, fertilisers, etc. This will allow her to start sowing as soon as it is possible and later to harvest the fruit of her labour. She is confident that the harvest will be abundant, which will enable her to improve her own quality of life, as well has her family’s.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, such as seeds, insecticides, fertilisers, etc.

loans.name: Douglas Alexander

texts.es: Douglas de 24 años de edad reside junto a su familia. Es un hombre visionario que lo que a él más le ha importado en la vida es dar lo mejor para su familia y que estos se lo agradezcan el día de mañana. Es muy trabajador se ha caracterizado por ser muy emprendedor.Actualmente posee una pequeña cosecha donde cultiva arroz, frijol, maíz . Buscando el bienestar de su familia Douglas desea ampliar más su cosechas, mejorarlas y que siempre sean las preferidas por los clientes  es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos básicos como: fertilizantes, pesticidas, semillas, abonos u otros .Siempre buscando lo mejor para su familia espera contar con la ayuda necesaria y así seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
24-year old Douglas lives with his family. He is a man with an eye on the future--for him the most important thing in life is to do the best he can for his family. He knows they will be grateful to him one day. 

Douglas is very hardworking and enterprising. He owns a small plot of land where he grows rice, beans and maize. Because he wants to ensure the well-being of his family, he wishes to increase production, improve the harvest, and always be the preferred supplier to his customers. For this reason he has approached INTEGRAL for a loan to buy basic agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, manure etc. As he is always seeking the best for his family, he hopes the loan will be approved so he can continue feeding and supporting his family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, manure etc.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
This is Amalia. Her previous loan was a big help to her business as well as in the education expenses of her children. Her business is continuously growing as she and her husband work hard. She makes bed sheets, pillowcases, and curtains.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan that will be used in buying raw materials such as fabric, needles and the like. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Amalia dreams of expanding her business and having more shops. She hopes that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Tita is 61 years old and has one child who is in school.

Tita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and other fishing equipment.

Tita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Tita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Jercita

texts.en:
Jercita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Jercita has been in this business for 17 years. She earns more income from buying and selling livestock.

Jercita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Doña María Elena, tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales dos están estudiando, vive en San Juan Pueblo, la Masica, Atlántida.
Doña María tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos, útiles escolares (cuadernos, mochilas etc.), achinería y refrescos. Hace 8 años que inicio este negocio viéndose en la necesidad de obtener otro ingreso económico que le ayudara  a suplir algunas necesidades, como la educación de sus hijos. Desde entonces trabaja mucho obteniendo buenas utilidades con las cuales ha podido hacer crecer su negocio. Trabaja tiempo completo vendiendo su mercadería. 
Ella  lleva varios financiamientos con ODEF en el cual manifiesta le han ayudado mucho en la estabilidad de su negocio, el que solicita actualmente es el quinto ciclo y es por 10,000 lempiras para surtir su tienda con mercadería como ropa,  zapatos, sandalias, cuadernos y útiles escolares.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para darles a sus hijos la estabilidad económica para sus estudios.
texts.en:
María Elena, 41, is married and has five children two of which are attending school; she lives in San Juan Pueblo, La Masica in Atlántida.  She has a business selling clothes, shoes, school supplies (notebooks, backpacks, etc.), low-cost novelty items and soft-drinks.  She started the business 8 years ago needing to have an additional source of income to help cover some of her needs like her children’s schooling costs.  Since then, she works hard earning good profits that have led to her business’ growth.  She works full-time selling her merchandise.

She’s had previous ODEF loans she says have helped her much to stabilize her business.  The one she’s asking for now is for 10,000 Lempiras to stock her store with merchandise like clothes, shoes, sandals, notebooks and school supplies.  Her goal is to continue working to give her children the economic stability needed for their schooling.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like shoes, sandals, schools supplies and clothes.

loans.name: Yudis Maria

texts.es: Yudis de 35 años de edad se dedica a la venta de productos farmacéuticos desde hace 5 años, cuando inició su negocio con la expectativa de participar al mismo tiempo que generaba ingresos, en la educación y crianza de sus dos hijos, y en la atención de su esposo. Con su negocio ha logrado apoyar los gastos de su hogar y poco a poco ha ido agregando, además de medicamentos, artículos de miscelánea, que vende de contado en un punto comercial, ubicado en su propio domicilio en el sur occidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Su trabajo inicia desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, de lunes a domingo y este gran esfuerzo ayuda a que su negocio crezca, logrando consolidarse en la comunidad objeto de su mercadeo. Desde hace 3 años ha estado vinculada a los programas de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, en la cual ha sido apoyada, por 3 financiamientos con los que ha ampliado su negocio y aumentado el surtido de productos para la venta. Yudis con su esmerado trabajo, tiene grandes propósitos enfocados en el mejoramiento de su calidad de vida y el de su familia, para ello necesita hacer que su negocio sea cada vez mas rentable, ofreciendo una gran diversidad de productos que tengan pronta salida en el mercado; esta es justamente  la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, cuarto crédito que aplica a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos farmacéuticos de alta rotación, porque le generan un volumen de utilidades que le facilita aumentar su capital de trabajo, para reinvertir y ganar cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Thirty-five year old Yudis has been making her living selling pharmaceutical products for five years.  She began her business with the expectation that, while she was earning money, she would participate in educating and raising her children, and caring for her husband.

With her business, she has been able to help with household expenses.  Little by little, in addition to medications, she has been adding miscellaneous items, which she sells for cash in a shop located in her home in the south-west of the city of Barranquilla.  Her work starts from 7 in the morning to 9 at night, from Monday to Sunday.  This great effort helps her business grow, allowing her to become established in the community of her target market.

For 3 years, she has been connected with the programs of the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, in which she has felt supported.  She has had 3 loans, with which she has expanded her business and increased the variety of products for sale.

Yudis, with her conscientious work, has lofty goals focused on improving the quality of life for herself and her family, but she needs her business to be even more profitable, offering a great variety of products that sell quickly.  This is precisely the reason why she is applying for a Kiva loan, her fourth loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy pharmaceutical products that have high turnover, because they generate a profit volume that allows her to increase her working capital, in order to reinvest it and earn even more.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She earns a living through providing transportation services. She has been doing this for three years so as to support the needs of her three children. She gets an income of PHP 10,500 a month from this business. 

For a 29-year-old mother, there’s nothing more that can make her happy except to see her children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Angie is borrowing an amount of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC Microcredit to repair her transport vehicle used in her business, and provide her children a better education. 

Angie joined GDMPC in 2012. Her plan for the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Ganhurel

texts.en: Ganhurel, 32, lives with her husband and 4 children in small house in Ulaangom soum of Uvs Province, Mongolia. Her husband Nyamdavaa, 34, helps her with her traditional costume manufacturing business. He also sells them at a rental counter in a local market. Her sons Jargalsaihan, 11, Adiyahuu, 9, and daughter Gunselmaa, 6, go to a local primary school and her younger daughter Onormaa, 2, goes to a local kindergarten. The borrower has been manufacturing traditional costumes at her home for years and she has built strong relationship with her customers and suppliers over the years. She is now requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase inventory for her business to increase her sales during the highest season. She is a hardworking, friendly and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her business to increase her sales during the highest season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 57 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Daisy works very hard to provide for them.

Daisy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks and beverages. 

In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money to buy a vehicle for her business and repair her family’s home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 55 years old and widowed with four children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like biscuit, soft drinks, detergent and school supplies.

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Evelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like biscuits, soft  drinks, detergent and school supplies.

loans.name: Dismar

texts.en:
Dismar is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 48 years old. Dismar is married and has two children. To make a living, Dismar operates a family member's business providing motor transport services. Dismar has been engaged in this business for 12 years and earns 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2011, Dismar joined GDMPC. Dismar is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which he will use to repair an existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old and single. She Lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Gina owns and operates an auto repair shop serving customers in the local community. Gina had her business for seven years. She earns a monthly income of 40,000 PHP. 

Gina joined GDMPC since last year and now she requesting a loan of 45,000 PHP to purchase additional materials used in her business. She plans to improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials used in her auto repair business

loans.name: Rudiah

texts.en:
Rudiah is 43 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with four children who are between 22 and 10 years old.  They are all in school.
Rudiah is a farmer and has been for the past 14 years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use on her farm.
She hopes to be the top farmer in her area.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Flor Del Transito

texts.es:
FLOR DEL TRANSITO tiene 23 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con unos familiares en la ciudad de Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

FLOR DEL TRANSITO se dedica a la venta de comida ráìda. Solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor. Con las ayuda del crédito podrá comprar un telesisor para el hogar. 

Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda. El sueño es mejorar el nivel de vida. En el tiempo libr ele gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Flor del Transito is 23 years old. She is single and does not have children. She lives with some family members in the city of Chimbo, in Bolivar province. 

Flor del Transito sells fast food. She is requesting the loan in order to buy a television. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy a television for the home.  

She makes her purchases in the city of Guaranda. Her dream is to improve her standard of living. In her free time, she likes to watch television.

loans.use: To buy a television.

loans.name: Inna

texts.ru:
Инна живет и работает в Мелитополе. Она торгует на крупном местном рынке женской одеждой и бельем. В ассортименте ее товара в основном куртки, кофты, блузы и т.п. У нее собственное торговое место, опыт работы в этой сфере бизнеса составляет уже 15 лет. Однако в КИВА Инна обратилась за потребительским кредитом. 
Инна давно мечтает сделать ремонт в кухне, тем самым улучшив свои жилищные условия. В ее планах использовать сумму в 22 000 гривен именно для этих целей, а именно выложить пол в кухне плиткой, рабочую стенку обложить кафелем, поклеить обои на стены, покрыть потолок гипсокартоном, а также поменять бытовую технику на кухне и кухонную мебель.
texts.en:
Ina lives and works in Melitopol. She trades at a large local market, selling women's clothing and underwear. Her products are mainly jackets, sweaters, sweatshirts, etc. She has her own shop. She has 15 years experience in this field. However, Inna asked Kiva for a loan.  

Ina has long dreamed of renovating her kitchen, thereby improving their living conditions. She plans to use 22,000 hryvnia for exactly this purpose: namely, to tile the kitchen floor, lay a tile back splash, hang wallpaper, drywall the ceiling, and get new kitchen appliances and furniture.

loans.use: improve living conditions by renovating her kitchen.

loans.name: Petro

texts.ru:
Петр использовал предыдущий кредит от КИВА по назначению: за счет этого увеличился его доход и он смог добавить еще два столика в своем кафе. Увеличение прибыли в процессе управления бизнесом способствовало улучшению качества жизни всей семьи Петра.  
Петру понадобилась сумма в размере 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести новую кофеварку, микроволновку и некоторый другой товар для кафе.
texts.en: Petro used his previous loan from Kiva as he planned, and due to this, his income increased he was able to add two tables to his cafe. His increase in profit through good business management has improved the quality of life for Petro's family. Petro needs 15,000 hryvnia to buy a new coffee maker, microwave and some other goods for the cafe.

loans.use: buy a new coffee maker, microwave, and some other goods for his cafe

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business. She is also doing manicure, pedicure, massage, hair rebonding and other services. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 30,000 PHP, to buy beauty products and hair products needed in her salon. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain their daily and business needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Adelaida hopes to expand her business and wants to help her family financially. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty products and hair products needed in her salon.

loans.name: Flora Ali

texts.en:
Flora is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 11.  All of them go to school.

Flora runs a small general store and has been in business for four years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2000 SSP to purchase tomatoes, beans, oil, and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Flora would like to expand her   business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Flora says she is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan   through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like tomatoes, oil, beans, etc

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita, 53 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Jimenez with four children and is earning a living from her transport service business. It started almost 5 years ago and she earns 3,000 PHP a month. To improve business, she is borrowing the amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit which she just joined in 2012, to obtain accessories and tires. She’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business before long.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 40 years old and comes from Ndunyu Njeru. He is married with six children who are aged between four years and 17 years old.

Moses is a farmer and he has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy two heifers which will help him boost milk production in his farm. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan.

He hopes to expand his dairy farming and be able to improve his family's standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: To buy two heifers

loans.name: Leus

texts.en:
This is Leus. She previously received an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for her personal, household, and business expenditures. This has been Leus's business for five years now and it keeps growing as she works hard.

Leus would like to apply for another 24,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed in her store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Leus hopes that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир занимается сельским хозяйством в Виноградове. У него есть 1 гектар земли, 3 теплицы по 3 сотки и ещё одна размером в 5 соток. Владимир занимается выращиванием цветов и капусты. Он берёт на работу наемных рабочих в период посева и сбора урожая, тем самым предоставляя работу односельчанам. Более того в бизнесе задействована вся семья и родители Владимира. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже 15 лет. 
Владимир с огромным удовольствием занимается этим бизнесом. Сумму в 10 000 гривен он планирует вложить в подготовку к новому фермерскому сезону, а именно приобрести семена цветов, пленку на теплицу и удобрения для земли. В будущем Владимир планирует достроить собственный дом, в котором живет с женой и 2 детьми.
texts.en:
Vladimir farms in Vinogradov. He has one hectare of land, three greenhouses which are 300 (meters long) and one which is 500. Vladimir grows flowers and cabbage. He hires workers during the planting and harvest, thus providing jobs for the villagers. What's more, Vladimir's entire family and his parents are involved in the business. He has been doing this for fifteen years. 

Vladimir takes great pleasure in his work. He plans to use 10,000 hryvnia to prepare for the new farming season. He needs to buy flower seeds, greenhouse film, and fertilizer. In the future, Vladimir plans to finish building his own house where he lives with his wife and two children.

loans.use: buy flower seeds, greenhouse film, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Virgelio

texts.en: Vergelio is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Vergelio operates a family member's business providing motor transport services. He has been engaged in this business for six years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2012, Vergelio joined GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Zarnigor

texts.en:
Zarnigor is a very smart and active girl. She is 19 years old. After graduating from school, she was admitted to the university. She studies at the correspondence department of the Tajik University of Commercial. She is a student of the first course. 

Zarnigor lives far from her university. That is why she does not have enough money for transportation every day and why she studies at the correspondence department. She also works at a shop as a seller. She sells a variety of sweets such as candies, biscuits, etc. 

Zarnigor's parents are workers and do not have enough money to pay for her education at the university. She is asking for a loan of 550 USD to pay for her tuition. She is going to make her payments by herself. 

Zarnigor has great dreams for the future and awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 34 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Rosana owns and operates a farm where she plants and harvests vegetables and coconuts to sell. She earns 7,500 PHP each month. 

Rosan is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional fertilizers, seeds, seedlings, and young crops.  She joined GDMPC in 2012. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers, seeds, seedlings, and young crops.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline, 42, is from Kisauni. She is the mother of seven children and she is a merchant by occupation. She sells clothes at the market.  She hopes to grow her business and improve her profits to have more income and be able to invest more in her business.

Magdaline is asking for loan that will allow her to buy a bundle of clothes for resale. She feels that this loan will be of great use to her because her sales will increase, generating higher profits that she will reinvest in her business and use to do home improvements. Her future plan is to expand her business and she hopes that it will generate higher income so that she and her family can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ardian

texts.en:
Ardian is 31 years old and already has four children, ranging in age from 1 to 8 years old. They live in a village in south-eastern Albania and they live below the poverty level, despite their great efforts to make a better life. “Sometimes it doesn’t matter how much you want to change your life, you just accept it as it comes because, in my case, I find my hands tied - no money, no education, and no opportunities to do something either,” Ardian said, while looking at his children. “That better life will remain a dream, I guess,” he said.

“I wanted though to thank very much World Vision Albania for providing for my children, and now VisionFund Albania and Kiva that together are giving me the opportunity to add another milking cow to my existing one so that I will be able to sell milk and other dairy products to bring an income home,” Ardian said at the end of his interview.

Ardian is photographed here with his two youngest children, Elvis and Enkela.

loans.use: To buy a milking cow

loans.name: Geovani Osvaldo

texts.es: Geovani de 20 años de edad habita junto a su esposa es casa humilde pero propia. Es un joven muy responsable, honesto y visionario que siempre se ha caracterizado por dar lo mejor de si para su familia. Actualmente se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como frijol y maíz, todas las mañanas se levanta con nuevas esperanzas de que en su hogar no falte el pan de cada día, ya que es el único que trabaja y es el responsable de llevar el sustento diario. Geovani desea que sus cultivos crezcan y así las ventas de igual forma se vean más reflejadas es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, pesticidas, semillas, y demás. Confía en Dios que la colaboración llegue antes del tiempo de lo previsto y agradece a las personas de buen corazón que le harán llegar el préstamo adquirido.
texts.en:
Geovani, 20, lives with his wife in a humble house that’s nonetheless his.  He’s a very responsible, honest, forward-looking young man who has always stood out for giving his best for his family.  He currently works growing basic grains like beans and corn.  He rises daily with renewed hope that his home will never lack daily bread since he’s the only one who works and is responsible for producing daily sustenance.  

Geovani wants his crops to grow so sales will too which is why he’s asking INTEGRAL for  a loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and others.  He trusts in God that the collaboration will arrive ahead of time and thanks the good-hearted people who will see to his getting the loan.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Milton Rodrigo

texts.es:
MILTON RODRIGO tiene 57 años de edad es casado tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívra.

MILTON RODRIGO tiene un camión para transportar maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar piezas para el carro, corona, frenos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá arreglar el vehículo para seguir trabajando.
Los defaíos a los qeue se enfrenta es la competencia y cuando se daña el vehículo.

El sueño es comprar un bus interprovincial. En el tiempo libre le gusta viajar y conocer otros lugares.
texts.en:
Milton Rodrigo is 57 years old, and is married with three children. He lives with his wife and children in Chimbo in the Province of Bolívar.

Milton Rodrigo has a truck to transport maize. He is requesting a loan to buy parts for his vehicle, gears and breaks. With the help of this loan he can fix the truck to continue working.

The challenges he faces are competition and vehicle damage.

His dream is to buy an interprovincial bus. In his free time he enjoys traveling and exploring new places.

loans.use: to buy parts for his vehicle, gears and breaks.

loans.name: Susana Elizabeth

texts.es:
SUSANA ELIZABETHtiene 23 años de edad es soltera  no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

 SUSANA ELIZABETH es ayudante de cocina,además se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, abonos, líquido mata maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura.


Las compras las realizrá en la ciudad de Guaranda cada semana. El sueño es tener terrenos propios. En el tiempo libre le gusta compartir momentos agradables con la familia.
texts.en: Susana Elizabeth, 23, is single and has no children; she lives with her parents in Chimbo, Bolívar Province.  She’s a cook’s helper and also works in agriculture growing corn. She’s asking for a loan to buy supplies like manure and liquid weed killer.  With help from the loan she’ll be able to buy what’s needed for agriculture.  She will make her purchases in the city of Guaranda every week.  Her dream is to own land.  She enjoys sharing pleasant moments with her family in her free time.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like manure and weed killer.

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
Lolito previously had a loan for 18,000 PHP, which he used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business. His earnings helped  with his personal, household, and business expenditures.  To earn additional income, Lolito also repacks different condiments and sells them around the community using his bicycle.

Lolito is requesting another loan 20,000 PHP loan, which he will use loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better, resulting in increased profits. His profits from his business will help him to sustain his family's daily needs. 

Lolito hopes to have his own house and dreams to expand his business.  He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages.
